review: I've been coming here since they opened. I absolutely love their food. Menu has changed but you can ask for certain things that don't appear on the menu and chances are you'll get it.  Service is good sometimes. I guess it depends on the day and time. Sometimes your food comes quick other times it might get lost but you'll eventually get it.  I have never really ordered drinks here until I came with my boyfriend. We decided to hit the bar because the wait was long. First of all, there was no bartender for awhile but we can see him. He just ignored us for a LONG time. When he finally took our order which were two long islands, he prepared them rather quickly. Pro??? Nope, our long islands tasted like lemonade with a twist of "WTF is this!?!" As soon as he gave us our drinks he vanished. We couldn't or better didn't get the chance to bring the taste of our long islands to his attention.  When we were finally seated we asked the host where the bartender was to pay for our drinks but he said it would go on our tab. Okay....waitress was nice. We ordered, our food came, we ate....waitress brought our check. As soon as she brought our check she too vanished. Our drinks weren't on their....we didn't even get the chance to tell her because we were rushed out. So if you want free long islands, virgin long islands that is by all means hit this place up.
Any place that can't make nachos is a bad place. I'd rather eat nachos at the movie theater if u can believe. The burgers are alright.

Wow! My first one star review! Okay, so the food was pretty bad, but the service was the inexcusable part. I ordered an iced tea and a beer. Both of my drinks were handed to a random person at my table, and they in turn had to hand them to me. With neither beverage was I ever offered a re-fill. I ordered a plate of nachos and specifically said they would be my entree and I wanted them at the same time as everyone got their meal, the waiter served them as if they were "for the table" and handed to someone across from me before anyone else's food came.  Food was pretty bad compared to other Red Robins (and nearby restaurants). Paying was similar, all of us had to walk over to where all the waiters were (as they were standing in a circle talking), and we had to repeatedly explain to our waiter who had what so he could separate our bill. Afterward we put attached our cards to our bills and handed them to him. We had to watch over him as he swiped each card, and he then randomly handed cards back to the wrong people.  Generally the food was bad, and the waitstaff were offensively apathetic and neglectful.

WOW what a drop in everything this place has had so back in the day (around 2009/2010) some friends and I would always visit this red robin, sinc it is the only one in valencia  anyways, the burgers were always amazing! the whiskey burger and california chicken sandwich were my favorites, and although many places' steak fries are soggy and raw, red robin's steak fries were always crispy, fresh, warm, and delicious the service used to always be great too! always getting out frie baskets full and drinks refilled quick with friendly service buut now we are here..march 2012..with a completely different story! there were 8 of us on a friday night, and the place was pretty busy... no one waiting outside but the place was full. for one the waiter was nice, and fine with us seperating checks for each party/pair  got our drinks, first refill, took orders all good then the appetizers came...not from out waiter...and our waiter was suddenly gone.. then another pair of waitresses/servers brought out our entrees. my california chicken was pretty good (fyi comes with grilled chicken, bacon, gucamole, swiss, lettuce, tomato, onion, mustard, asked for no mayo and whole grain bun but the fries...OH WHY THE FRIES?? ITS ALWAYS THE RUM!  well in this case the fries but if youve seen pirates of the caribbean youd understand anyway, the fries were soggy, over salted, and kinda gross...lets just say i didnt order a second basket, let alone finish my first serving then our original waiter comes back for the checks for a $10 bill i left about $1.50 in tip, just doubling the tax probably wont return for a long time, and if i do will be during non busy hours

Fantastic service!  I've been to many Red Robin's throughout southern California and I believe this was the best service we've ever had.  We stopped in for dinner yesterday while on a day trip to Six Flags.  Our server was Alex (Alejandro), and he was very quick to take our order and brought refills often.  In fact, I never had to ask for a refill at this location; something I really appreciate. The food was great as well.  Our family of three had Fried Mushrooms, Cheese Sticks, Towering Onion Rings, Clucks and Fries, Southwest Chicken Pasta, Potato Soup and the Kid's Peperoni Pizza with Side Salad. Thanks and keep up the good work.  I'll be coming back on my next Six Flags trip.

Saw red robin by chance as we looked for parking. We normally wouldn't eat here, but we were hungry and went to the mall to take our son to meet some Disney characters. As we walked in from the lot, the place was bright and bigger than I imagined. Not too packed since it was around 4. Our male server was very nice and took our order. We got our drinks and appetizer fairly quickly ( half jalapeno coins and half cheese sticks) The jalapeno coins tasted like del tacos but pricier. He even refilled our drinks. Then as we got our dinner, he introduced us to a new waitress since his shift was over. Not once did we see our new server. My husbands drink was empty again and we didn't see anyone working to even ask about our server.  Finally my husband got a different servers attention for a refill. Getting the check was another long wait. But I did notice by the bar about 3 of them were talking and didn't look busy. The table next to us waited about 15-20min just for someone to take their drink order, then waited about 5 min and just walked out!! ( we seriously thought about it too since we couldn't find anyone to ring us up!!) One guy had to have his daughter approach a guy with a MOP for some napkins! And the booth behind us asked that same guy to order and inquired about their server and he said he was looking for one. Anyway, we won't be coming back. And i'm not sure those other 4 tables will either. The food was ok, what you would expect from here. I got fish and chips, but the fries tasted old, like it's been sitting there and not hot and had no salt. They have seasoning at the table, but usually fries at least have some flavor. It's free refills on fries but no thanks. My husband got a burger which was ok. Not bad, but not the best either.

The service at this Red Robin is terrible. No matter if it is busy or empty, it takes them forever to do anything. Almost every time I come here I end up having to get up to get someone to refill my drink, bring me more fries, or give me the bill.  The only reason I come back is because the food is delicious. I usually get the mushroom swiss burger with a veggie patty and it is great. I just wish they would have better customer service.

Not impressed at all.  The food was lousy.  Really not worth the price, especially when compared to other establishments in the same price range.  We ordered their new Tavern Double burger.  Not good at all.  I've eaten here before and use to like their food.  The quality seems to have gone south.

Awful service, our food came after waiting 30 minutes (there were only 2 other parties in the restaurant), at which point I was ready to leave.  Our waiter was rude, and didn't apologize for the extremely long wait.  I will NOT be back.

Pretty good service as far as Red Robins go. I've been here twice on the way to vacations in the LA/SD area and the food is always great.  They also offer 99cent chips and salsa (no guac)!! The service was a bit slower the second time, but still great because she was always there with a drink or what we needed. Great food too, YUM!

This place is a bit pricey for burgers, fries or onion rings.  I had to send my burger back because it was bleeding in the middle and the food takes 20-30 minutes so don't come if you are in a rush. I also saw my waiter once or twice and no more and a different waiter brought the food to the table. The only reason they got 2 stars was the light speckled lemonade was good.
This has always been my favorite restaurant in Santa Clarita. The service is always great, the food is delicious and the price is very fair.

Wow, I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet.  I generally find the service here sluggish, though very friendly.  The reason I always come back is for the Bleu Ribbon Burger--it's one of my favorite burger atrocities when done right.  But last night the flavor combo seemed off--not enough "chipotle mayo", crunchy onions, or bleu cheese; burger was not as juicy.  I also woke up at 2:00 in the morning, nauseated and uncomfortable.  I know it wasn't the Screaming Red Zombie--that was screaming more sugar than booze.  I really hope it wasn't the burger, because I would be very sad to drop that from my SCV dining menu.  Perhaps I'm just not able to process that much salt anymore.  Sigh.  With age comes the responsibility to eat healthier and move beyond the salty comfort of the Bleu Ribbon Burger.
Got a free burger on a specialty day. They were totally cool about it too. The staff seems happy everyone was there. They seemed to enjoy their jobs.Food was perfect, burger rocked & fries rocked.

Friends and I went came to this Red Robin for dinner tonight.  The place didn't look very busy, but it took 45 minutes for us to be seated.  Service was HORRIBLE!!! The icing on the cake for me was when he asked if we wanted more water.  The waiter took our glasses to refill them.  When he brought them back he used the old glasses.  When he brought them back he handed my friend my glass.  I only noticed it because I asked for a water with lemon, and I ate my lemon.  Most places either bring a picture of water and fill right there at the table, or bring new glasses of water, and take the empty as they put the new down.   We ordered appetizers.  It was taking forever for those to arrive so I asked him what was taking them so long.  He came back to the table and explained that there was some mix up in the kitchen.  (I don't buy any mix up.. clearly this kids forgot to put our order in.)   When he did finally bring us our appetizers he sat them on the table.. No forks, plates, napkins.. nothing. It was at that point I had enough. I tracked down the manager. She took him off our table.  I will say Cody was a better waiter and kept checking on us..(that is why I gave it two stars.) The manager was VERY kind too.. I gave this one start only because this is the worst flu season in a very long time.  She can't have a waiter like that mixing up glasses.  Not to mention it is just gross.. I live in Northridge.. never had issues like the ones I had tonight. I will NEVER be back to the Valencia Red Robin.. I wish I checked the Yelp reviews BEFORE I went.. I would have went someplace else..

My girlfriend and I were walking the mall this weekend taking care of some chores, and saw a place that I'd not visited in a very long time. As you can imagine, I'm talking about Red Robin in the Valencia mall. We had to stop in and give it a try, seeing as the last time I'd visited one was years ago in the Palmdale mall.  I would like to say that I had the best server that I've had in a very long time. Alan and company took care of us without having to mention that our water was empty, etc.  If the food matched the customer service, this place would really have something. I'm not saying the food was terrible. It just wasn't amazing, or even something worth mentioning. We got the bagle bites with the beer cheese and mustard sauces. The beer tasted kind of ruined the cheese, and horse radish was a little too strong in the mustard. We shared a turkey club, which wasn't exemplary, but good. My biggest issue with it, was that the turkey itself tasted like they got it out of the lunch meat isle from a local grocery store. The bottomless fries tasted like the same.  The quality seemed mass produced, and of a lower standard than their competitors in the area. The price was right and the service was exemplary.  I'll be coming back for the happy hour prices and good service.

It's good for what it is.  I have only been to one in Portland area so this was my 2nd time at a Red Robin. I love the jalapeno coins... Great fries, good fish'n'chips, decent burgers and salads. Nothing outstanding but good for chain-burger-joint

Ok so I have been here several times with my family, my kids always seem to like their kids meals a lot. So your wondering why the two stars! First of all the restaurant can be almost empty and they leave you waiting to be seated. Second the service here really sucks, your server either forgets about you or you get one that has an attitude. Third just went yesterday and my garden burger was nasty, and my mom's seafood platter tasted bitter. If there food hadn't been good previously, they would have only received one star. I won't be coming here again for a long time.

I went on a Tuesday afternoon and it was fairly empty. I usually love going to Red Robins for some burgers and fries so my friends and I decided to go there for lunch. We got seated right away and our server was very friendly.  we got onion rings to start us off and they were delicious, crispy just how I like em :) I got the Red Robin Royal burger and I split this with my boyfriend. It was more than enough since we had onion rings and bottomless garlic fries. Before, Red Robin used to have free garlic fries but now they charge a dollar for them.... and they charge over a dollar for sweet potato fries! I mean I say that they're worth it but our garlic fries barely had any garlic on them and it was just basically regular fries sprinkled with really little cheese and almost no garlic.  The server suggested spicy ketchup and she said she really likes it but when I tried it it wasn't even spicy and it just tasted like ketchup. Also, my friend ordered a monster size of their shakes and BEWARE. It's 5 dollars and you get the normal shake in the cup and you get the extra cup of the leftovers from when they made it but it's not a lot. This is what normal diners do when you order a shake but Red Robin calls it a "monster" shake ..... uhhh I don't think so.. Overall, I've had better food and experiences at other Red Robins.

Every time we come to this place, we have to wait our food for about 30 minute-ish and I think it's very slow, specially when you see there were not too many customers. The burgers are pretty good except the mushroom burger. It was too dry and bland, I think McDonalds angus mushroom is WAY better. The servers are never friendly. They look so tense, like the restaurant are really busy which was not.  Compare to Red Robin in Topanga mall, the servers in Topanga are very friendly.

After years of driving by this place and hearing good things about this franchise, I finally wound up going here for lunch on a Tuesday. Parking is only as easy as to how busy the mall will be. Restaurant was pretty empty, which means fast service. Overall though, majorly disappointed.  Somehow got talked into getting a monster shake (friend mistakenly thought it was unlimited) which taste-wise, wasn't too bad, but nothing spectacular. But at almost $5 for the shake and extra tin it comes in, not worth it at all since it's just regular sized (even a little small compared to other places). I'd rather buy $5 of ice cream and make my own shake. Ordered the prime chophouse burger that comes with mushrooms, onion strings served on an onion bun for $10. MEHH, not that great, at that price, it was like a 4/10. Got the unlimited sweet potato fries for like an extra $1.50, they were actually pretty decent but I think the garlic fries that my other friends ordered was much better. I like that it's unlimited fries but you can really only eat at max 2 orders since it's so starchy and potato-ey that you get super full super fast. Our server was nice and friendly enough, checking in on us a couple of times. Overall experience though was probably right on the dot of Yelp's 2 star review "Meh. I've experienced better." The prices are a little too high for the quality and quantity of food you get (I guess except the unlimited fries). TLDR: 'monster' shake was puny, overpriced burger, plus for unlimited fries (+$ for garlic or sweet potato)

Whether your looking to grab a bite to eat or watch the game with friends Red Robin has you covered. They offer many traditional American staple dishes like burgers, fries, sandwiches, salads, and soups. Also, offering plenty of beers on tap. This location being attached to the Valencia Town Center is hardly busy. Their peak times are usually on the weekends for lunch and dinner. Overall, I believe the food is ok but overpriced for the final product they put on the table.

Man I love the Burgers at this place. I always add on the ghost pepper sauce to any burger or chicken sandwich I get its awesome. The rib lets and mac and cheese are also good. I think its great they give you bottom less fries with your burger orders too.  They have a nice menu for kids also. The last time we went the service was not too great. But that is once out of the many times we had great service there. If its still there I suggest you try the genius chocolate shake because that was awesome too. But if your in the mood for a really good burger go to red robins.

Went back with a large group.  Service was SPOTTY.  My partner and I split a salad and the waiter had the order all wrong.  My soup was cold.  They were sold out of the chips and dip.  The salad plate was chipped in multiple spots all the way around.  We didn't get our bread that went with the salad.  If one server cant handle a large group, please send in help.

We absolutely love this Red Robin location. The burgers are always great, the service is always top-notch! We've been here a number of times and buy our Red Robin seasoning from this location as well. All of the wait staff is incredibly wonderful - but our latest waitress Brooke was above and beyond the best waitress we've had in a long time at any restaurant. Whenever we get a craving for a great burger, we always think of this Red Robin first!

Mmmm...that Burnin' Love Burger and bottomless fries (with the spice mix). And bottomless drinks. Typical Red Robin food. I've been here twice for late night dinners (post-Six Flags, so we come hungry), and it's been satisfying both times. When I came last week (visit #2), we were served by a girl name Taylor who was impressively cheerful and attentive despite the fact that it was approaching 11 pm.  Four stars for Taylor. :D
Kim Cameron, Valencia, CA Red Robin makes a fantastic burger!!! Yummmmmy!!

This place is just the pits!  How can you get a burger wrong and take 30 minutes to get it wrong?  Our server was a young whelp who did nothing to help correct the issue.  Don't waste your money here!

visiting from out of town, always a big fan of Red Robin but the  service was HORRIBLE.. the server was great, she was very nice. But, 4 tables were seated AFTER us and ALL had food before us.  she kept coming back and saying your next, but it was a good 30 minutes before our food came.  by that time, my girls had so many drink refills tummies were full and 1/2 the food we had to take to go.

I have Celiac Disease and therefore have to eat gluten free. I came to this place because I saw online that they have a gluten free menu. They did, and there were a good amount of items on it. But the best part was - they had gluten free hamburger buns!!! I can't even tell you the last time I had a burger with a bun on it (well, until this burger, that is)!! I was so happy, and out waitress was very nice and knowledgable about what I should and shouldn't have. I recommend this place if you're gluten free and craving a burger with a bun!!!

Wow, what an awful experience. We got there at 11:15, they open at eleven. It took forever to get the waitress/bartender to see us, she wasn't even ready to start work. I ordered a beer, my Mother a coffee, the beer was flat and it took forever to get the coffee. The tables were a mess and not even organized for opening. You open at eleven, be ready at eleven. I got a burger, it was undercooked my Mother's fish wasn't cooked properly, it was greasy and the batter wasn't even cooked properly. We told our server and she shrugged her shoulders and muttered, "Oh" and walked away. Never again, you get one chance when I'm spending money and that was their chance. The bill was $39.47, tip.....0

Whiskey River BBQ Burger - Amazeeeeballs. I never get through more than one portion of fries but bottomless is always awesome. I am always sat in the bar section and there is only one bartender serving everyone on that side so service is pretty slow. Food is always delicious so I keep coming back.

We were at a kids birthday party yesterday and this was our first visit to this location. The hostess seem to be in a hurry for everything. The silverware was not washed or was not washed property as we can see stains from the last use. I got the Clucks and Shrimp entree. It was just gross and tasted horrible. It felt like they just microwaved frozen breaded shrimp and chicken. I ate a few shrimps and left everything else for trashing. The entire dish was loaded with oil and grease and what not. The coleslaw was okay but only has 2 spoonful. I just couldn't stomach anything after that. We had onion rings which I tried a few pieces. I would avoid Red Robin anytime in the future.

Best burgers around...try the lettuce wrap burger.  It is made with lettuce instead of a bun.  Also, the strawberry lemonade is tasty. The fries are delish and so hard to resist. Servers are friendly.   The time before last the place seemed dusty and just not well cleaned.  All the stuff on the walls and things on the ledges had cob webs. Eeww!!! We just started looking and noticing - wow, this place needs an intense cleaning!   This recent visit -  it was clean.   The décor needs a major update.  The cheap posters in cheap frames on the wall are faded and things just look like they are ready for the trash.  Skip the Goodwill and send it straight to the dump. Hopefully...they will refresh the Valencia location soon!!! Hello, Red Robin - come do a makeover of this location.  Then you'll be a 5-star choice for sure.

I've been here at least four times and each time it seems that the service is on a decline with longer food service wait times and not enough concern about the customer. Perhaps it could be because the employees are more concerned about watching the TVs than attending to customers!

We visited this location on the night of 11/15/2013. Our server, "Toby" was awesome. Toby was extremely attentive and friendly, he made sure we got everything we need, A+ for his service! Minus one star because there was a 15 minutes wait for seating when there were plenty of empty tables all over the restaurant. After the wait, we end up getting seated at a table that was already available the moment we've walked in.

I just paid $4.49 for a 'Monster' shake.  It came in a 22oz cup maybe 75% full.  I've had shakes in their restaurant before and they fill a glass and leave extra in the steel mixer that they leave on the table for you.  I don't know if this was a mistake or an optical illusion but I got ripped off.  I recommend buying shakes up the street at In and Out Burger.  Bigger, cheaper, and at least as good.  Thanks for curing me of my Red Robin shake craving forever.

Well Black Friday sealed the deal.  My wife and I have been coming here for several years. Today we walked up to the counter and the hostess told us there was going to be a 15-20 min wait. We know it's busy so that was fine. We stood there for 10 min. Several groups walked up and we heard the same thing  15-20 wait. I don't mind the wait, but I counted 10 empty tables. Finally we saw a group of four walk up, talked to the hostess.  They walked over to an empty table and sat down. A waitress walked over and took the drink order and went together them menus.  The food here is decent but the service has been on the decline for some time.   Now they are on the no fly list. Good bye.  I'm writing this at dinks deli. Let you know about this place in a little bit.

Ate here for the first time in years. Forgot how good it was? Ordered the Burnin' Love Burger that comes with jalapenos inside and a roasted pepper on top. It was gone in seconds because I couldn't control myself after the first bite. I think i bit off a kids arm but can't remember because my eye lids rolled back like a shark during an attack.  For mall food, you will definitely have a good experience here.
Horrible service. Place is empty and they still think it's ok to serve cold food?!?!? Second time getting no service, will def not return.  If I could give 0 stars I would!

One of my co-workers birthday had passed by two days ago. So, I had decided to treat him to lunch. Instead of having burgers from fast food place. Why not have a Gourmet Burger?! A Gourmet Burger from Red Robin. You'll be able to find Red Robin at the northeast section of Westfield Valencia closer to the Citrus St. entrance. Red Robin is connected to the mall, but I cannot tell you which stores are located next door. My co-worker and I were greeted and seated at one of the booths near the parking lot. There is another dining area that you will be seated at if you enter from the mall.  Our server was Desiree, a hot, blue-eyed, tattooed waitress. My buddy ordered Iced Tea and I got a lemonade ($2.79 each). He was all set for a juicy burger. I cannot recall if he did order the Red Robin Burger ($8.99) with Onion Rings (+$1.49) or just ordered something else. My receipt says Chz BG. It could mean, Cheese Big Guy! I ordered a familiar meal, Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Wrap ($9.99) with Red Robin's Bottomless Fries. Desiree made sure our drinks were filled while we waited for our meals. I was very surprised that there was a lunch crowd from people taking their breaks. I would have thought that this location would get a crowd after the work shift ends. More and more people started to walk in, but our food just came in right in time. My co-worker loved his burger and his well-done onion rings. As for me, I always love enjoying my Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Wrap. However, I could not finish my first order of fries. Thus, it could not be bottomless fries. My buddy was able to finish his meal, but I was ashamed that I could not. He loved his well-done onion rings and I wish I had changed my fries and gave him my onion-rings. Double-birthday gift for him. It was good meal, but I swear my stomach did shrink. Ultimately, my co-worker enjoyed his meal and his meal was well deserved. Desiree did her job and I almost thought I needed to do a tat job. Now, I need to find another Red Robin to invade. Do you think I write too much? Well, you can call me a Yelp-O-Holic!

I go here for lunch at times when I have coupons. The service is ok, (variable depending on who's there and how busy it is...once or twice I've had a really whiny waitress), the food is ok, and it takes a reasonable amount of time to get my food. Other than that it's a standard red robin. I'd recommend it over the Johnny Rocket's in the same mall which has god awful service..
Best shakes in town!!! Good and quality burgers. I will be back!

The food is great but the service sucks! We waited a good 10 minutes before someone finally acknowledged us to be seated. Before she sat us down she asked us to wait a minute so she can answer the ringing phone. The restaurant wasn't busy at all. Seemed that it was over staffed for the amount of customers...so surprised service was still so poor.

I come here at least once a week and it never fails that something is wrong with my order or I'm sitting way to long waiting for my food. Burgers are good but not worth my time to bring any more of my business here. Sorry...

I don't normally review chain restaurants 'cuz they are what they are, but yesterday i was so annoyed w/the service, i have to hope someone there cares and reads this. The lady who sat us asked if table and chairs were ok.  Sure, i don't need to sit in a booth.  She seats us in a table that was literally right on top of the service area.  Really??  I had my back to it and didn't notice when we sat down 'til all the servers were huddling around.  Now, the place had maybe 10 tables seated, why seat us on top of the service area??  It was very uncomfortable. I can't imagine there was a manager there at the time 'cuz everyone was goofing around, walking around, bringing in Starbucks and parading it all through out the restaurant.  Talk about unprofessional!!  Starbucks is for your break, not for your job!! Then our server took our order, brought our drinks and then disappeared.  I'm watching the counter and see what i know must be our food and it's just sitting there.  Seriously, 10 minutes.  Just sitting there.  Another server picked up the dishes and put them on a serving tray and then our server finally showed up and delivered it.  My son ordered mandarin oranges and got fries on the side, but she did bring oranges to him as well, so ok.   Naturally, my sandwich was cold and so were the fries.  I waited for her to come back to ask "how is everything" or at least check on us.  Never happened.  She even approached the table, looked at us, froze and said out loud "what was i doing??  oh yeah." and walked right past us.  Really??  Walked right past us as if she weren't even serving our table.  Didn't even ask if we wanted more fries!!  Nothing!! After i choked down my cold food and the kids were done, she came over to our table, put down the check and said "i'll take that when you're ready."  Not, how was the food, thanks for coming...just give me your money and get out.  Which i did.  I normally don't leave anything less than $5 for a tip, no matter what the tab is.  She got $3 and i was being very generous...lucky for her i didn't want to wait for my change, which could've been another 10-15 minutes coming.  I couldn't wait to get out and get gone and not sure we'll return.  I've always been a "Red Robin...YUM" kinda gal, but that may well have been the straw that broke the camels back.  Management, you really need to weigh in on these servers.  Way too lackadaisical for me to spend my money here anymore.

Usually I'm a big fan of Red Robin's food, but not from this location.  I went there a few weeks ago with my family for dinner, they served my 2 year old daughter 20 minutes before the rest of us, so she was done eating and ready to go by the time our COLD FOOD arrived.  The waitress told us, our food was coming out and then let it sit there until it was cold.  Who serves cold soup?  And cold chili burgers?  Only benefit, my kid didn't have to wait for her food to cool off before digging in.  Either way, I had to leave with my kid and go home before being served, the rest of my family stayed and ate, they said that the manager served them personally and didn't even bother to apologize for the service, just set the food down and walked away.  Place was empty and the whole ordeal took almost 2 hours total.... Horrible Service, will not be back since, IHOP has better service.

I went to RR with my young son and his three cousins. Needless to say my hands were full and to top it off I am sick. Mallory was my waitress and she was top notch. She made sure these crazy kids had everything they needed so I could relax. Service and food was excellent. I will be back
I gotta say, the burgers are pretty good. If you go, I suggest you try one of the burgers. -John

I need Red Robin Rehab! I am here almost every week when I have the money. I always get a Royal with no tomato and eat like 3 baskets of fries. Super nice waiters and hosts/hostesses here. Service gets slow sometimes but that's expected when it's the super busy weekend rushes at a West-field mall and I don't mind because I'm never in any hurry. Just munchin on mah fries til I get my bill or next course. Really love this location. If I worked at the mall I'd be bankrupt from eating here every day for lunch. EDIT Ever since Red Robin had moved from the mall to McBean parkway service has gone downhill. I'm never in a hurry when I'm out like I said but damn, won't see condiments til dessert, if a all. The bartenders are doing everything. Don't get my extra fries anymore when I ask, my orders been completely messed up, I have gotten the wrong bill and the manager doesn't seem to care. I'm not the only one who's given a poor rating since the change... Fix your shit.

I had been to Red Robin in Simi quite a number of times when I was younger. I remembered liking their alfredo pasta, chicken strips and strawberry lemonade. I had one of the best lunches I've had in a while with my bf yesterday at this location. A+ for service and food. Doreen was our waitress and she was so nice and super cool. Not once were we left waiting for refills on drinks or fries. (Although we did wait a bit long for the food to arrive and it didn't seem too busy). I ordered the clucks and garlic fries w/ strawberry lemonade. He ordered a smoke & pepper burger, regular fries and a corona. Hands down one of the best garlic fries I've had. Of course I took advantage of them being endless! The chicken strips were even yummier than I remembered! Crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside. His burger looked sooo good with the melted cheddar and crispy bacon, I didn't try it but he was very pleased with it. Definitely "gourmet." I did notice a facelift to the menu since I've been last. They no longer had pasta. Mostly a bunch of burgers. Which isn't a bad thing. We will definitely be back!

This place gets 4 stars mostly because of the awesome service we had from our server Terra. She was one of the most attentive servers I have ever had (without a lap dance).  Anyways,  great burgers at a great price and we didn't have to wait all nigh r to eat.
My wife and I come all the time. Never had to wait. Sat at both the bar area and main area. Everyone has always been helpful. The have good food and good prices.

Supervisor or Manager Eric let's just call him SuperMan lol. On more than 5 occasions Eric and his staff have gotten better and better. If I'm with friends, family, solo eating or just walking through to get to my car everyone is so nice and at times, I can here my name in a restaurant. Wow, how cool is that!!!! I love them dang burgers and the fries . Keep up the great work and see you next time.
Ordered food to-go today. It was alright. The picture always looks better than what you get.

My friend really wanted a shake so we came here. My bluemoon shake tasted like an orange creamsicle it was good. The food was alright. My burger bun was a little over toasted but i aint mad. Sat at the bar and the waitress was nice and attentive

Been to a few red robin locations before. But this one is always great. Great customer service, great food and great prices make this place a weekly adventure. I've never had a bad experience.  I have had to wait, but that's what you get when the place is awesome. Thanks red robins.

Reeed Robin, yum! I love Red Robin! They've got a good menu, decent service, and it's right inside the mall. I come here a lot because they've got good food for good prices. Bottomless fries are also a big draw ;) My favorites are the chicken caesar wrap and the chicken bruschetta sandwich, both served with bottomless fries, yum! Ask for campfire sauce with your meal and dunk those fries into it, so good! They are best known for their burgers though, so if you're a burger person you should try those out. My boyfriend loves the one that comes with a fried egg! Service is hit and miss here, but lately it's been more of a hit with me so I give it the full five stars.

My Fiancé, myself and his daughter visited there establishment for lunch around 1:00pm today. We were very disappointed with the service we had received. First of all it took 7 minutes for someone to even greet us when we walked in. There were three other groups a head of us who were still waiting also. Once we got a table the waitress named Doreen was not very accommodating or friendly. I had ordered a burger and fries well done and was sharing it with my fiancé. When we finally got the food I went to eat it and realized the burger was bloody on the inside so I asked her if I could get it cooked more. She refused and said that I needed to order another burger also because my fiancé had already started eating the other half she said that I would have to pay for another if I wanted well done even though it was there mistake. All together it was a disappointing visit I'm sad to say. I though customer service was important. Obviously not to her or her manager. I refuse to eat there again.
Food is always good, but this location is incredibly understaffed and mismanaged during hours which should be anticipated for high traffic.
Other then being in love with there endless fries, our server Taaron is honestly the best mos attentive server I have ever had...

We went for happy hour...only they didn't have a happy hour. The food was good and cheap. My husband got a soup and salad for $9 and drinks reasonable. Cheaper than when we go to Salt Creek for happy hour. I would have given them a 5 star rating except the waiter was not too attentive.

I absolutely love eating here! I come here all the time with my friends and we always have the best service. We usually have a different server every visit and they are all very nice and the food gets to our table pretty quick. The food is delicious and reasonably priced. And I can't forget to mention the bottomless fries! They are the best fries I have ever tasted. Whenever my friends and I are thinking of eating out, most of the time we choose to go to Red Robin. This restaurant has yet to let me down. I would recommend Red Robin to anyone visiting Valencia or just looking for a great place to eat.
Once again. Ball dropped. Please don't eat here!!! Big business does not care about customer service AT ALL!!!!
I'm a big red robin person and this location had good food but totally crummy slow service.

Came in early Sunday night, no one was waiting but we were told it was a 20 minute wait. When we asked to be seated at the bar, the host told us he had to check if anyone else was waiting. There was not one person waiting anywhere! Meanwhile we stood at the check in counter watching all of the servers stand around talking to one another. Left without bring served, will not return.
Good food but the service is too slow. Took the server 20 minutes to even notice we were there. Will not go back.

Worst burger ever! Today was the 2nd time they messed up my burger.  This establishment has continually  getting worse over the years. It took forever for our order to come out and there were basically no patrons in the place. The quality and preparation of the food is abysmal.  Word to management and line cooks: Ensure when food is brought out, it does not sit around for 10 minutes til the other dishes for that table are prepared. You have to know what the preparation time for each dish is.  My food was so cold that, I asked my waitress to heat it up again. The sad part is that I don't think they truly care if they give you cold fries vs hot fries. More like a 'whatever' kind of an attitude.    For the grief and money spent,  In-N-Out schools this establishment many times.  Never will I come here again.
I have been working in the mall for about 10 years and made some wonderful friends here. They have amazing service and are always inviting. The food is GREAT and my order is always accurate.
I love Red Robin, but for some reason this one is terrible. They're always slow(maybe they're hoping you'll forget what you ordered) and they manage to poorly prepare everything we've ordered.

The service here and quality of food is not as great as some of the other red robins franchises. The burgers were very soggy and tasted almost as bad as something out of a McDonalds box...but I will not pass judgement on all red robins restaurants. Also the salted caramel shake  tasted almost exactly like salt! The beer was good!

This location is poorly run.  We were seated next to a table stacked with dirty dishes. Wait staff and management continually passed the table without clearing a thing.  The condiments and menus were sticky.  And it took more than 20 minutes for our order to arrive.  This location doesn't stand up to the quality of other locations. I definitely won't return here.

My boyfriend and I come here a lot because of the good food and friendly staff. I always order the crispy chicken burger with no onions or tomatoes and add cheese. They always get it right, although some of the chefs cook the chicken a tad much. Depending on the time of night if it's close to closing the fries can be a little cold but they are willing to fix it if you mention it.  Also, just want to say that I'm updating my review from 3 to 4 stars since the last time we have been here. Last time my bf ordered a Irish car bomb and the girl was new to bar tending and made us something completely different. After reading the review she realized what happened and remembered us on our next visit. She made us a new one the right way this visit on the house which she didn't have to do and it was very kind of her. Going to leave the price of one plus what we were normally going to give her as a tip. Great to know they pay attention to their reviews and use them to improve. :)  My bf gets different burgers and most of the time it turns out ok but if it's way busy things can sometimes get added or left out but they always fix it. We come here because when the food is good it's really good and we love all of the servers we have had especially Toby. He's always polite and super friendly. If there was ever any issues if we brought it to the managers attention they were always very helpful and polite. We will continue to come here.

Great burgers and even better dipping sauces! I seriously come here for the fries and sauces. They're to die for. The service is great and the waiters are always pleasant. Great place to bring the family and large groups. Must try place.

As I used to frequent this location quite often, I figured why not hit it up for a quick lunch with my coworkers.  Unfortunately, it seems they have gone downhill quite a bit.  The first thing I should have noticed was that it was pretty empty for a Friday lunch hour.  Being that my coworkers and I were engaged in conversation, I wasn't really paying attention to the fact it was nearly empty.  We were approached fairly quickly by the bartender (we were seated in the bar area for some reason) and we asked for 3 waters while we looked over the menu.  About a minute after we got our water one of my coworkers told me "you better order a drink because this tastes like tap water".  He was dead-on.  I couldn't even drink the water even though it had lemon in it.  Still, we pushed ahead (I mean we do have a water crisis in CA right? maybe they're cutting cost..) then I realized everything on the menu had jumped significantly in price since the last time I had been there.  Burgers now ranged from $11-$15.  OK, I thought, maybe the quality is better than I remember.  I definitely don't recall them being super-gourmet or anything, but they were decent, so let's see.  My two coworkers ordered the BBQ Chicken Wraps and I ordered one of their newer burgers (Some Ghost-Pepper/Jalapeno burger I forget the name).  After about 15 minutes the food came, and the first thing I noticed was that my burger wasn't even warm.  It was as if the patty's were sitting in a prep-tray and just slapped on the buns without any heating involved.  Then I checked the fries - yep.  Not even warm.  At this point I'm fairly disappointed. Due to the fact we were on lunch, I wasn't about to wait another 15 minutes for a new burger, but I figured I'd let them know how disappointed I was.  After the waitress (bartender) came back to ask how our food was, I explained to her the situation, and she said, let me get "him" (I assume she meant the manager?) and your check and I'll be right back.  We sat there for another 10 minutes waiting, nothing.  Here we are on the tail end of our lunch hour and as she walks by again she says "he's coming in a second".  Another 5 minutes goes by, and I see a lady named Tara approaching.  Not sure why since the bartender kept making reference to "him" and "he's coming".  So Tara approaches and starts telling us she's "one of the managers" there, and she's really sorry about the food.  I explained to her we've been waiting nearly 15 minutes for someone to come over here, and we need our checks as we're going to be late getting back to work.  "Sorry, I was on a phone call" was the response she gave me.  Super irritated at this point, obviously we were no concern to anyone at Red Robin despite expressing our dissatisfaction already.  At this point I'm wondering if the "him" the bartender kept referring to didn't feel like dealing with a dissatisfied customer so he sent Tara over..?  At any rate, Tara returns a few minutes later and said she gave us the "family discount" on all our bills (which was $2.12 off my $16 check) and said to us "I'm always here, next time you come I promise we'll do better"... uh.. what?  So she needs to be there next time for them to do better?  Offered nothing else to us, and was clearly irritated with the entire situation.  Probably wanted to get back on her "phone call".  All said and done, all three of us agreed we'll never return to this Red Robin.  Total waste of time and money.  Obviously not too concerned with their customers.
Excellent customer service. Amazingly sinful food. Chocolate fruffles blew me away....
My hubby and I were passing through and glad we stopped. We had a very attentive server and we were able to pick everything we wanted on our burgers.
Best experience here ever. Cody was our server and he is amazing. Always like Red Robin,  but this was extra good.

This is a nice location inside the mall but not really knee deep in the food court. It's nice that they serve beer but the bar is pretty small. It's ok because there are lots of booths. The beer is limited but pretty good. All of the food we had was either deep fried or double deep fried. And the service was super nice but came to the table about 5 times just to see if we were okay. Maybe hoping we'd order more food, I don't know. But all in all its a great diner and great wait staff.

Everytime I eat here I get sick. At first I thought it was just me so I went again, I get sick EVERY single time. It's not just me, I asked my friends and they said the same thing happens to them too. Not coming back.

I've agreed with some regarding the lower ratings. We went just the other day and had a great time. Food was good and so was the service. We noticed a huge change. We asked if there were managers and they said yes. They got 2 new ones. What ever they did it's working. They also mentioned they were moving over to where the elephant bar was.

I've been coming here for years! Almost 15 years at that.  I don't know why there are so many negative reviews. I do have to agree, ever since the establishment has been trying to become more "higher end", things have slowed down. However, it's not like anything is unbearable. My food and service is always quick and very well. I've been coming here so long that my family and I are known by name, and most of the servers already know what we order by memory.  The servers are incredible, and there is usually never a wait. I will continue to return as long as the establishment keeps their doors open.

Was really looking forward to a juicy red robin burger with my fiancé last night on date night. No doubt the food is good. But I am writing this review because of my overall experience with the bar tender. We had a seat at the bar and waited for about 10 minutes before being acknowledged by the bar tender. Keep in mind this place was not busy at all!! There was another couple at the bar and that was it. Anyway asked for a food menu, never received it. Asked for a drink menu got it 10 minutes later. Ordered a drink got it 10 minutes later. Was there for about 30 minutes overall and all we had were 2 drinks. Decided to go to TGIF down the street. I would not recommend this location to anyone, and will not be back. I guess I'll have to go to the topanga mall location in the future.

Service was horrible.  We asked for refill on our drinks and the waitress paid no attention to who each drink belong to and mixed up our cups.. Gross. Next we asked for our bottomless fries and she gave us 2 baskets  with a couple of fries for our party. The lighting and boths are so full of build up dust. I can't believe management has not noticed.  I will never come back !!!

I took a seat at the bar....10 mins before anyone said anything to me, another 10 mins before I got my beer. 20 mins, is that ok?  My order was wrong, the food was ok and it was hot inside the restaurant. I still tipped 25% because that's low for me and I just didn't want to be a no tip guy, but it would have been warranted. What has happened to my Red Robin..?

My husband and I came here because we received a gift card. I love burgers more than anything so I was pretty stoked. We came in and all the booths were dirty. I guess they don't have a busser. I ordered the guacamole burger and it had about 1/2 teaspoon of it on it. The party was way over cooked and actually burned. My husband got the chophouse and said all he could taste was the grease from the onions on it. Our server was great though. So hence the 2 stars. Will not go here again.
Takes 10 years to walk in , order and pick up your food, did they butch the cow in the back or something? The wait is way way too long.
I've always liked their burgers and the easy comfortable atmosphere. Great variety and find for groups and kids. Customer service is OK so only rated at a three.

The food is really good and they always serve good beer. But I stopped going for a long time because the service was so horrible, didn't matter who it was. I would wait forever to get my food and if I asked the server for a refill, there were many times I never got it. I recently started going back and only because Toni in the bar made me have the best Sevice and even remembers my name and order. I only go if she works, she is the reason for the 4 stars! Ask for her !

My husband and I love Red Robins but the service at this specific location is very poor. We just picked up a to-go order and it took forever. We ordered the buzzard (hot) wings and when we got home, we noticed there was zero sauce on them, very dry and gross. We had asked for ranch and instead we got poppy seed dressing. My turkey burger was sloppily and loosely wrapped in a crinkled up paper and when I unwrapped it, I noticed the paper had old dried cheddar cheese on 2 sides. I usually love cheese paper, however, the turkey burger didn't have cheese on it. It was wrapped in a used wrapper....so gross! Lastly, the fries are completely unseasoned. Never again. Next time we want an awesome burger and service, we're going to Bricks.

Meh. This place can be great with awesome service one day and then slow the next. High, high turnover. The food is generally good. Dine in service is usually slow but acceptable where take out can take ages and they will forget something so always, always check your order before you go. What's nice is that Corporate is quick to hand out gift cards when a location screws up, so there's that.

I am a fan of Red Robin especially their burgers. I usually eat about 4 burgers a year but every time I am at Red Robin I have to get a burger! I like all of them, so it depends on my mood as to which one I go for. I have only been to 3 different locations and the Valencia one is my least favorite one, not because the food was bad, but because of the service. Now the wait staff is good, don't get me wrong, they are just understaffed always. Each server tries their best to accommodate, but I always feel like I am bothering them when I need something. I blame management for not having enough staff on hand, other than that the food is great

Worse service EVER. Walked in and was told there would be a 15 min wait and I'm starting at 10 open tables. Not to mention the people who come in from the front are being seated right away and the two tables that haven't been bussed since we have been waiting. Think will go to TMI Fridays. Good day.

Food was terrible. Sent some of it back and told them to forget about replacing it. Took FOREVER to get seated and then FOREVER to get our food, and they weren't even that busy. It seemed like the manager was stopping at almost all of the tables apologizing for one thing or another. We won't be going back there!

Worst service or really no service is more like it. First off let me state I hate giving bad reviews. I've been in the restaurant biz all my life so I'm pretty sympathetic and generous when tipping...never leaving less than 20% sometimes more. I can overlook a few mistakes in service but I had a completely bad experience. I came in by myself. I waited at the host stand for a few minutes and no one acknowledged me. I finally started walking to a table to seat myself and that's when they noticed me. I asked for a table on the patio that sticks out in the mall walkway. I sat down. Someone did come by to explain how the automated iPad thingy on the table works. I told them I didn't want to interact with the iPad thingy since I'm on a computer all day long. I wanted a server. (By the way...the self ordering is going to be restaurants answer to $15 per hour wage...get used to it). I waited and waited for someone to come all the while sitting around 5 dirty tables that had not been cleared. Yuck. Those tables should be cleared immediately since everyone walking by in the mall can see the dirty tables. I finally raised my arm and started waving my hand. A server came and took my order. He then brought my iced tea and waited for my burger...still sitting amongst the dirty tables. When my burger arrived it was dropped off so fast I didn't have time to ask for a knife. I waited some more before I flagged another down for a knife to cut my burger in half so I could eat it. The knife finally arrived as my burger was now cooling. My fries were cold and had to flag down another to get my fries replaced for hot ones. No one ever came to ask me if everything was okay or refill my tea. I finished my burger still sitting at a table surrounded by dirty dishes. The burger was just okay. The fries were good after they replaced them with fresh hot ones. No one asked me if I wanted anything else. Sell, sell, sell servers. It increases the check amount. I asked for my check and left just 10%. I didn't even want to leave that but like I said...I'm in the biz. I so wanted to take the servers aside and teach them how to increase their tips to 15% and 20% every single time. In the restaurant business it's all about the service. Anyone can get food anywhere. People don't have to tip but if you give them good service and you make their experience a good one, it's like putting your hand in their pocket and taking the money out. They will come back or not come back because of the way you made them feel. Especially pay attention to single people. They have nothing to do but look around and count time.
Service, what service. This place has hit a new low.  Management, get off your lazy posteriors and hire and pay for real, professional servers.

Every time we come here we say, never again! Then a year goes by and we forget. So we're back to never againland, again. The server/bartender is nice but spread too thin. We had no sugar for our iced tea. We finally got food but no silverware or napkins. The chophouse burger was cold and the fries had been warned by microwave. So this is how they avoid requests for seconds on their bottomless fries? Ugh! I blame management. You're understaffed and your quality is substandard. Frankly, I'll pick Wolfcreek next time because NEVER AGAIN!

Terrible. Truly terrible. Took 20 minutes to seat us even with the restraunt half empty. Asked the host for a menu and he absent-mindedly handed me the nutritional guidelines brochure. When we asked for butter for our bread we were told " I'm not sure we even have any. No one's ever asked for that. Let me check." the server then came out with a cup of melted butter. There is a RR by our house which is excellent. This place is a joke. Message to the management - please hire someone to train your staff, since you cannot. NEVER COMING BACK.

Ok after my bad visit 2 years ago we tried this again, Wish I had not. First we went in server placed our order without writing a thing down we waited 30 min for our order, I ordered a double cheese burger plain it comes well not plain..I sent it back and guess what happens yup they replace the bun scrap off the condiments this is a no-no in a plain persons world and I could not wait any longer so I let it be.. My wife got some sort of chicken dish with a salad and she said the chicken was like rubber and had a terrible taste that went back and in place she got a mediocre tortilla soup...all in all we had some decent French fries and a good root bear float cost me $24 and I left feeling discouraged and hungry. Never again... This bird won't be back to your nest.

I like Red Robin, always have.  I have always been a sucker for the Banzai Burger or any burger with grilled pineapple on it.  The fries were not quite up to usual standards this time.  I ordered a Coors Light, but server needed to change barrels first, I thought about it and got their version of Long Island Tea, which was terrific.  So I was lucky that the tap was temporarily dry and I could rethink my decision. I was amazed with our server.  She was running the tables in the bar area and making drinks for the rest of the restaurant.  She was fun to watch, she never made an extra motion, something happened every time she moved. After reading the other reviews I must have come in on a good day.  I'm really not that easy to please.

I went to Red Robin and ordered the crispy chicken tender salad. It was awful. No egg, the lettuce is no longer iceberg and the bread was terrible. I asked the waitress what happened. She said they changed the lettuce and hard boiled eggs were on back order. This was one of my favorite salads and the only reason I went to Red Robin. I am very disappointed and will not be returning.

It was a Tuesday, and it was just about one o'clock in the afternoon. I was at the mall waiting for my new eyeglasses to be ready upstairs at Lenscrafters. I had seen all the cute animals at the shelter-pet store, and I still had to kill about an hour.  Since I hadn't eaten anything thus far in the day, I was pretty hungry.     I was lured to Red Robin by the wondrous photos of burgers on the signs advertising the restaurant. They enticed me to step closer to them, and eventually step just a bit further and enter the establishment to ask for a table. I was quickly greeted, and ushed to a seat.     Waitress came by quickly. Since I was one of a small handful of people in the place, she was quite attentive.        For the past few days, I'd been hankering for a big fat burger, and when I saw the table tent advertising the Uberbuger, I was fairly easily swayed into a decision. Uberburger appeared to have some kinda weird bun, a sausage, and some grilled vegetables all atop a big fat cheeseburger. Long story short, I ordered the burger and was informed that it came with bottomless fries. From my understanding, all Red Robin burgers come standard with bottomless fries. So I ordered, and waitress shot off to give the order to the cooks, and quickly came back to refill my iced tea.       Before too long, a large big fat burger was placed before me. The fries were in a shiny metal cup next to the burger. The burger was ok. But it was definitely a large and messy thing. The pretzel bun ended up falling apart long before I was done with the burger. But overall, the burger was decent. The fries were also pretty tasty. Waitress had given me a tub of ranch dressing to dunk the seasoned fries in.     As I ate, waitress came back often to refill my iced tea, and to also inquire about a fry refill after I had finished the fries given to me. I was already quite stuffed with the burger and the fries I had already eaten. Any more and they'd have a cleanup to deal with.  However, I do like the idea of bottomless fries. I wonder if you could just spend an afternoon at the mall peoplewatching and eating french fries? I'll have to ask about that on the next trip.    After visiting the restroom to wash my hands of the grease and burger gunk, I took care of my bill on the electronic doohickey at the table, and then left to pick up my new glasses. Total was twenty-five(ish) with tax and tip. A tad on the pricey side, but the burger was big and bottomless fries.      I'm not at the mall all that often, but when I visit next, I think I'll stop in here at Red Robin for endless fries....and maybe a big fat burger.

I brought my aunt to Red Robin last Saturday for lunch. I ordered the Red Robin burger (the one with egg on it). The picture on the menu is what made me order this burger. My aunt ordered it too. Well it wasn't what we expected. It had no flavor and I only ate half because it was far from delicious. My aunt ordered a orange creme soda and was disappointed but drank it anyways to not waste it. I ordered some expensive strawberry lemonade the waiter suggested, but it wasn't worth the price I paid. I think it was $4.99. I ordered lemonade after I finished the nasty strawberry lemonade and and it also wasn't that good. The waiter was nice, but the food was substandard. We won't be back.

I'm currently on the phone after dude asks me if I can hold for a brief moment.  That was 10 minutes ago. Seriously?!  I hang up and try again- the girl "Becky" picked up and immediately placed me on hold.  Rude. Third time it worked... however I asked to talk to the manager.  I'm just curious why the person that picks up can't take my order.  That was all- needless to say- I didn't order and now I sit here to write this.  If they help the customer over the phone like this I can only imagine how they are in person... this is terrible service for a "gourmet burger" joint.  At roughly $20 a pop the service shouldn't be this mediocre.  I'm taking my business elsewhere.  Unsay Red Robin, UNSAT.  If I could rate them negative or even a zero I would. What a terrible experience.

Service is going downhill.. Today is the worst service I have ever received at this location.food came out cold don't normally order any but appetizer never came we walked out this really sucked, manager tried to correct but it just took too long speaking of put our name in and got passed up they claimed they called me but we were standing right there they never called us, what a bunch of screwups.

This was our go to spot for burgers in the scv area. We've had been to many burger places and this seems to be our primary only because if we needed to get something at the mall or what so ever. Their menu has changed, and they def had stepped up their menu. Your typical red robin joint. No difference, staffs are friendly, attentive and helpful with all the menus and very knowledgeable. The only bad part is that they have food flies around and its just very disgusting. We sit outside the patio and there they are.  We sit inside there are some. Just gross. Over all its good just not the flies when you are enjoying your food.
First time to red robin nothing to special nothing compare to in and out burgers. Good service fast and friendly  Fries are amazing

The family loves Red Robin, great choices for kids. Join the reward club and you get a free burger at #10. Also free burger for ur bday.  And they are delicious. Normally we have great service at this location. Update: went on 11/23/15. Service was horrible. We ordered our kids food as soon as we walked in. My wife and I ordered a few minutes after. Kids meals came out with a few minutes. Our kids had finished eating their food and our food had yet to come out. We waited over 20 minutes to get our food. Manager apoligized, as he left our food I noticed some random item in one of my sauces, asked me "should I replace it?" Really! It was horrible to get our food so late, the kids were restless waiting for us to finish eating. Pay our bill, no discount or anything. I left my original review because I loved this place, but after today I don't feel the same way.

My girlfriend and I Just left this restaurant without eating. Waited 10 min to be seated which is perfectly reasonable. I understand being busy. Our host Dillan was really friendly and kind. Best part about the evening. He seated us at a booth in the bar and told us our server would be right with us. There were three people running around and none of them were any servers we had seen before and we come here a lot. They must be seasonal. We waited around 15 minutes for someone to come by and introduce them selves and take our drink order but nobody showed. We thought that perhaps they were too busy so we would try to order our drinks on the ziosk to save them time. While trying to find the soda option to order my finger accidentally hit the call server button. It turned on a flashing red light and canceled the option to let me order drinks. At first we felt bad because I never liked the idea of summoning our server electronically but we figured at least someone would show up and we could get drinks and have them put in our order. After a few minutes of servers walking by and nobody stopping I wondered if none of them were our server. After a few more minutes I started to get annoyed because even if they weren't they could have let our server know we needed assistance. A few minutes after that we had been sitting there for almost half an hour and nobody had stopped or even acknowledged us. That's when we decided to just find another restaurant. As we got up to leave a woman came over and was grabbing plates at a table one or two next to us. She just looked at us and didn't say anything even as we grabbed our stuff to leave. We have been coming here for a long time and have always felt appreciated but tonight we felt like our servers couldn't have cared less. For the future if it's busy we will just find somewhere else to go that evening unless we see a server we know like Terra, Toby, or Jason because they're the best.
Bonzai burger with veggie patty was great and they lettuce wrapped my burger. Desiree goes above and beyond. Don't get garlic fries as they only have only garlic powder and not much of it.

Love this place. Has a great selection but my favorite is the chicken teriyaki burger. Comes with lettuce, tomato, pineapple, swiss cheese and teriyaki sauce. The grilled chicken is very juicy and tasty. Plus they have bottomless steak fries which are amazing. Place is always clean and service is good. Recommend to all. 5 stars, no queation.

I came here today with my mother and my one year old son for dinner around 7-8. It was pretty busy, but there was no wait and we were seated right away by Tanner. He offered to take our stroller and put it to the side and walked us to our table and brought us a high chair. He seemed like a wholesome nice guy. Our server arrived within 5 minutes to introduce herself, Mallory. She seemed in a rush and frantic and took our drink order. Once she brought our drinks she took our order, two different burgers. It took quite some time for our food to arrive. I saw people being sat and eating before us. My son was starting to get fussy and our food finally arrived. To my surprise, the updated food menu equals much better food! My Shroom Burger was delicious! I was kind of annoyed that my fries were the crunchy small ones that are at the bottom of the basket, but whatever. My son enjoyed my mom's side of broccoli and she enjoyed her burger as well. The food was amazing, Mallory was just okay. Not very memorable or extremely accommodating.
I Love this place, the burger's are five star and original! The drinks are fun and eclectic and they love kids too! Another larger location is coming in Valencia near Black Angus! What a thrill!
I love there burgers....clean , friendly and always packed . Burgers are cooked to the way you like not that greasy with plenty of toppings . A plus is bottomless fries.
The service is friendly and they always get me what I want in a good amount of time. Go to red robin, they will make you feel special.
Thats one of the most terrible services that I ever experience.   Its a shame that a beautiful place with good food has such a terrible service.  Burgers are good.   SERVICE SUCKS.

The DGB burger is actually very good, but horrible service and bad management puts a bad taste in my mouth.  The rewards program is a joke.  I went in on the actual day of my birthday for the DGB, and even though I enrolled for a free burger, They said it wasn't on my rewards account.  I showed ID to a mgr to prove, thinking it would be comp'd, NOPE. I was told to go home, email   and wait for my reward.   As of today, we were going to finally use my reward burger + use my Daughter's free kids meal for her birthday.  The email for the free kids meal can only be viewed twice, and unfortunately we didn't print right away.  I called and spoke with Mark, thinking he'd just honor the free KIDS MEAL because it's her 3rd birthday. NOPE!  Really Mark, a Kid's meal ?! He told me to email  .  Logging on to my rewards to email, I noticed the 'Free Birthday Burger' reward that I got, after emailing redrobin the 1st time, was NO LONGER there...!  I can only laugh....   I've told my wife I'm done with Red Robin.  DGB is very tasty, but mgmt fails to honor a kids bday meal + all the servers we've encountered, really are terrible.  Forgetting items, not refilling drinks, rude.... Thankfully, there are many other places in SCV to fulfill my love for a good burger. Also, while speaking with mgmt today, I learned the free birthday burger reward is only valid for the cheapo pub style burger, not the good angus stuff...  Ha.  Adios Red Robin...
Great Food. Won't take reservations over the phone. Expect you to wait when wait times can exceed 30 minutes.

Stay away unless you like unsanitary conditions, waiting for your food, and rude servers. I came here on 3/8/9 around 4:30 with my family for my 8 year-old daughter's birthday dinner (3 adults and 3 kids). Here were the major issues: 1) When the server brought us our drinks, he was holding one of the glasses with his fingers wrapped all around the rim of the glass--the part you press your lips against when drinking. That grossed my mother in law out to the point that she politely told the server he should never do that. She later felt bad about saying anything about it and apologized to the guy, but I think she was right to say something, since nobody wants to kiss the palm of a guy they've never met. 2) Though the restaurant was fairly slow/empty and had at least 3 servers working, it took nearly 30 minutes to get our food. We ordered 2 burgers, a bowl of soup, and 3 kid meals--with no modifications--so there was nothing overly complicated going on with our order. 3) When we first got there, a nearby table of 4 was having a birthday celebration and got the regular restaurant singing-by-the-servers-thing. My 8 year old daughter's eyes lit up and asked if they would do the same for her if our server knew it was her birthday. I said they might. I told the server it was her birthday, and he acknowledged me. Now, pretty much every restaurant I know of will bring you a scoop of vanilla ice cream along with the song to help a patron celebrate--that's all I was hoping for. I would have paid them to do that for my daughter. But...nothing. The check came, I paid, and he stopped by one last time to ask if there was anything else. Thanks, Red Robin--you'll never see us again. So if you like licking server's dirty palms with every sip you take, enjoy waiting inordinately long times for meals while your kids circle the drain, and like having your daughter's birthday summarily ignored--come here! But if you're like me and could pass on all of the above--GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!

Haven't been here in a while... Is this a restaurant, or a day care??? While trying to eat my meal, an unattended little girl was seated in a booth. Obviously an employees kid. This mis-behaved child was out of control, throwing items and toys around, sliding and spinning on the floor, even had her toys laying across  the area.  At one point, as the child was jumping around in the middle of the isle, she kicked a poor lady who was walking by who was using crutches. The employees saw this happen and did nothing...!!! The poor lady who obviously was in pain from being kicked, just looked around and was shocked.  Sorry Red Robin this was totally unacceptable..!!!  Several customers were looking around and  we're just waiting for management to step in and handle the problem, never happened..!!!!

I love this place. When my boyfriend and I are hungry, red robin always comes into mind. Fantastic found, quick service, and great atmosphere. Red robin isn't made up to be some fancy place, it's a quick fun paced burger restaurant.
Great place to grab a quick meal.  Food is above average and it is convenient.

This is was our third time coming to this location and I must say the best. Our Waiter Mitch made some great suggestions and delivered outstanding service including keeping my diet Coke full which never usually happens as I go through them pretty quick. Mitch had a great attitude and made our visit fun. We will be back and will make sure we ask for him as our server. The manager Mark also deserves to be recognized as he was running around helping all of his staff out and still made time to go to tables and check on the guests including us. It is rare to see so many good behaviors now a days but Mark displayed them and he is a true leader.

Red Robin has always been our favorite restaurant in Valencia. So much former coworkers would tease me when I mentioned we went out to dinner they would say "let me guess...Red Robin?" Tonight we were guests at a pre-grand opening training/welcome type invite for dinner and on a scale of 1 to 10 I would give RR a 11. Everything was beyond awesome. Our waiter Calvin was great and Steve, one of the managers was nice to come by and ask how things were going, then another manager Taylor came by and made our evening. We told her that the looks and atmosphere of the new RR was TOP NOTCH!!
Stop by to give the new location a try but was told you had to have an invitation. I drove 1 block down and discovered Islands. Great burger too bad Red Robin.
Opening up May2 2016 Got in on the preview!! Service was excellent! Enjoyed the $1.99 table game console! Food was delicious!! Can't wait for them to open up!  Had the whiskey burger!! Yummy!

Great food so far, lots of mistakes on opening day, nothing that would warrant a really bad review. They are PACKED!!!! Today so that's completely understandable and warranted. No worries, things get better over time especially when they get a larger staff.  Great steal for them to take over Elephant Bar's old place. Can't wait to come back and leave a better review!

So they moved from the location in the mall to right across the street... Arrived for opening night, and while it was very busy our server was on top of her game!  Great burgers, ventured into trying a can crafted cocktail And thought of it as a lighter Moscow mule: the coors light with ginger liquor, and lemon juice! Paired well with my jalapeño loaded burger! Added bonus and tip- try the sweet potato fries, no salt, extra crispy!

Just ate at the new location away from the mall.  Food was excellent as usual. Our server Jay was very nice/friendly, he kept apologizing for the wait which really was not that bad seeing as how it was the second night and it was packed.  The new bar is pretty cool, will be visiting often =)

Completely disappointed after going into the bar area and being told our 9 year old can't be in there. Not at the bar top, in a booth. We have eaten at most places in Santa Clarita and NEVER have we seen this. This may be allowed but 6-7 years ago it was against ABC laws. We like the bar area because the best servers are there and great happy hour specials. They have lost all of our business. It isn't a night club people! It's a hamburger joint! The person asking us to leave was kind, so I gave one star!!

holy frikin nightmare of a parking lot. geesh! they should also have a couple parking spots for To Go orders. regardless food is good but beware parking lot nightmare means restaurant is packed! I had to squeeze thru just to get to the bar for my food. it's not easy being pregnant and having to deal with inconsiderate guests from Valencia just to get by!

It's opening week and the place was bumping the whole night.  We were a party of 2 so we only waited 5 mins vs the 30 other families were quoted.  The redid place looks nice and I really enjoyed the atmosphere, more TV screens and better vibe.  Even the menu looks like it got an overhaul! I really like the bottomless broccoli option instead of fries, and they even have bottomless rootbeer floats! Without the grocery store open next door, it's got plenty of parking.   You can also order food and drinks directly from the table... how cool!
Overall food is still consistently delicious   The new decor is fresh and modern. Wait time was long but we had a chalk board   Nice touch for the little ones.

Came today at about 1 pm. Prime lunch time. Only had to wait maybe 2 minutes compared to the other families cause I was able to sit in the bar area. The food was really good, but all the silverware we were given was dirty. All 4 forks, and knives. It was disgusting, mayonnaise on the handle like it wasn't even washed. That was the part that I was not thrilled with. Please work on washing utensils more. That's a health violation.

Everything looks dirty in that restaurant already!The glass entry doors are covered in hand prints and glass partition windows that separate the bar & main dinning room seem dirty and dingy. Food took a while to come out and the plate look dirty like something still cooked on it from a prior meal. Hard to tell as the plates are black but, a smudge of finger print is very noticeable on black plate.  I thought the burger looks sloppy and uninteresting on the plate. Like some one bumped into a door as they brought it out. My burger was $14.99 only the price was gourmet. It's been 3 hours since I ate it and I feel the oily remains percolating back up. Yuk! There a weird ancient TV screen or over size Game boy on the table and when we asked the waitress what is was she said, " you can order, or play games from it." Since we sat at a small 2 man bar table I moved it behind me.
