After we (2) finished our 1 burgers  & 1small draft beers  each (no extras) $44.00 for lunch the bus boy picked up our plates and I was able to make eye contact with our waitress/ bartender and asked for the billed. She walked over and place the over sized Game boy back on our table and it had our bill dangling from just below the screen. I left the bill & payment at the table. Not sure if that was okay but, I wasn't gonna wait around anymore. I'd been there for 1 hr and it was 20 minutes too long already, I will never return. Seems to be a cheap  restaurant concept with the marketing focused on Valencia's reputation for being a rich community.   I
The new location is nice but the service was slow, our waitress was forgetful. The food was good but nothing special

We rarely ate at RR in the mall, but had high hopes for this new location. The sign reads "Red Robin. Gourmet Burgers and Brew". So, we thought maybe they're trying to re-vamp their image, or trying to attract the adult demographic. It doesn't seem to be the case. We sat in the bar area, which is where I suggest any adult without children sit.  I had the D.G.B., which tasted all right about 1/2 way through, and then the aftertaste set in. It was greasy, and I had a stomach ache the rest of the night. The broccoli as a side is a nice choice to have, but could they spare it? The "bowl" was about 3" in diameter and had about 5 tiny pieces in it. And, it wasn't fresh. Yes, I know it's supposed to be bottomless, but they could start out with a decent portion to start with.  $13.00 I believe was the price, which is about $4.00 higher than it should be for what it was.

Very decent prices, with a huge burger selection, bottomless fries, and Stone IPA on tap. The new location is awesome, a more modern feel than most Red Robins, and definitely cleaner. Service is fast and friendly. My only complaint is that despite the wide variety of burgers, a lot of them are simply over powered by the bun as far as flavor is concerned, so choose wisely. Not the trendiest or fanciest place in SCV, but the price makes up for it, hence the 5 stars.
Waiting an hour for our food and it was terrible. From the very start it was a horrible experience. Only bright spot was the Server.  This place definitely needs to get its act together.

SO TERRIBLE!!!!! food was disgusting and took 50 mins to get to our table! we ordered pretzel bite apps and it took 12 mins to get the sauce, by then the food was cold. The manager was no help and actually quite rude. The server Wesley was very nice and attentive- the only positive thing about our visit. We will definitely not EVER go back... Sad, I give this place less than a year before its out of business....

When this place was in the Valencia mall it was consistently good but in the new location it sucks (and I hate using that word)!  First, we were told it would be a 15 minute wait but it was 25.  I counted the empty tables and there were at least six set-up and ready to go.  When I asked about it the hostess explained it wasn't a lack of tables it was that the kitchen was backed-up.  Once we were seated we waited another ten minutes before I went back to the hostess to ask her to send a waiter over.  To her credit one appeared in less then a minute.  As I was writing this,  an exiting patron stopped by our table to add that we were lucky we didn't have their waiter since he was as slow as molasses.  Watching him I could see she was right.  Our waiter, Wesley, turned out to be great even explaining that the kitchen was backed up and it would be another ten minutes or so.   Note to restaurants: don't expand into a larger space if you can't handle the demand.  At least half a dozen parties walked out when they were told it would be a 30 minute wait.  Supposedly this is the number one outlet in the country but that will probably change quickly given how poor the service is now.

Came in to take advantage of the burger month special. I ordered the fiery ghost Tavern burger. Not impressed. The 2 patties were wafer thin and dry. My son had the royal red Robin, it was juicy and thick. Complete opposite. This is my second visit in 11 years living in Santa Clarita.  I think it might be 11 more before I come back. There are better burgers in the SCV.

Awful! The waitress took our order while holding a plate of eaten wings and scraps that she just picked up from the table next to us. Put a handful of napkins down on our table and the top one was dirty. The silverware was super spotty, almost dirty. The bathrooms were in much need of cleaning. Lost my appetite. Won't be coming back here anytime soon,  if ever.

I eat at Red Robins in multiple occasions frequently but this was my first time at the new Valencia location. I ate there today. Checked in at  1, seated at 135 after multiple people who arrived after us had been seated. Hostess said they had called us repeatedly but to no avail, hence the extensive wait. We were seated near the host stand the entire wait time so this made little sense. Upon being seated, table was still dirty, more specifically the floor. It was cleaned after we asked. Air was turned up so high that we had to wear sweaters. The patrons seated next to us agreed as did the server. Air was turned down and it became more tolerable. Unfortunately the air was turned back up after about 30 minutes. Very cold. Food took about 30 minutes to arrive. Bathroom messy...not a good experience. Disappointing. Will not return.

I live down the street from the new location and didn't like the Red Robin in the mall.....But this one is the real deal. The service was awesome and couldn't have been better. The food was outstanding, almost as if the restaurant changed. It's a pretty similar atmosphere as Elephant Bar was when it was there. This is now one of the best restaurants in the SCV.

The place was blinding bright in the dinning area, so we elected to sit in the bar. While in the bar we sat, sat, and sat. Eventually the bartender came by and we got our orders in, but not before asking him to clear the messy bar top......   C'mon have some  pride in your f'g work station!! "Mitch" our bartender was nice but needs to care for his bar. They literally cleaned their bar mats and dried them on top of the bar while costumers were still sitting at the bar. Although we like to drink, we like our servers/service. Pay attention to your customers and we'll take care of you. You still got your $20 tip, but only because we always keep our end of the deal, next time let's try and keep yours. FYI The place was far from busy. Tuesday night after hours! The bartop sat covered in crumbs and dirty dishes the entire night as it sat empty........lame!

Not loving what they did with the old Elephant  Bar and lacks the ambiance of the former RR mall location. Loud, bright, cheap plastic modern diner look. Smaller front room unbearable echoing cacaphony, The bar would have been the best place for ambiance and reduced noise level but swiveling bar stools at tables there leave a tall person's legs dangling  with the cross bar of the base too far back to rest your feet on it. Servers and hostesses very friendly and trying hard to please but what kind of training did they receive?  Seemed like they were a tad too ADHD from one table to the other, no flow or teamwork to deliver timely and satisfactory service.   As for the food, my mushroom burger arrived as though it had been thrown  across the plate, needed to be reassembled and was a dry overcooked tasteless burger, skimpy on the mushrooms which were also rather dry. Dining partner did better with the bacon double burger which was OK but not the quality  of Red Robin past.  Ice tea flavored with peach syrup was cloudy and tasted neither of tea or peach,  just some nasty soured chemical  concoction. Granted it is only a few weeks since they opened but there was nothing about this new location that would make me ever want to return.  Hopefully other Red Robins  don't adopt this new plastic image and equally plastic food.  What a shame!

Came here with my friends tonight. Has only been open I believe 3 weeks or so but their waiters were not trained well. We waited forever, orders were mostly wrong, took forever to pay since they wanted us to pay using those table computers instead of waiter just handling it for us and even the checks were wrong. AND WHAT WAS UP WITH Blinding light in the dining room area! Not coming back.

Our server Jacob was attentive and was knowledgable regarding gluten-free needs of one in our party. He kept our sodas filled and gave us plenty of ranch dressing. It was very busy as are all new or newly placed restaurants in our beloved Awesometown. I ordered the Ensenada Chicken and it was quite good. The bottomless fries were a hit with my growing boys. They also loved the Mac N Cheese and Bacon Cheeseburger. It is loud and the lighting is too bright in some areas. I felt like I was eating in a cafeteria. This is a great place to go with your little kids. Don't go here for a peaceful meal. Also, they spent a lot of money on the remodel, BUT they did not replace the old tile floor in the bathroom. It looks dirty and old and gross and just makes me wonder what the kitchen looks like.

Average food, took forever, and somehow they manage to make even healthy things become highly caloric and greasy.  Confusing menu, too many specials and burger types.  Too many drinks.  Too much everything -- talk about paralyzed by options/choices, this place is the poster child for it.  And most of the menu is just 87 different variations on a burger. Worst part was HOW LONG everything took.  At 2:30 PM had to wait 30 mins to get seated.  Then they separate appetizer for main course ordering.  Then it takes forever for the apps.  The forever again for the food.  Plus the booth with high vertical backs made it really uncomfortable -- and should you really seat a party of 6 in an booth?   And the intolerance to let the kids come in and order a coke in the bar area, even when at the tables and not at the bar. Fail, fail, and fail.

Horrible.   Used to go to the Red Robin at the Valencia Mall regularly.  We would sit in the bar portion with friends and family and have a nice visit and a good meal.   At the new location ( the old Elephant Bar location on Mcbean)  the food is still good but the seating is uncomfortable and all jammed together.  The bar area is raised stools now. This is now the loudest restaurant I can think of.  So loud we can't sit at a table and have a conversation without yelling and having to repeat ourselves.   We quit going after three tries and sitting in different areas with hopes of better acoustics.   Have to go the SFV for our Red Robin fix.    But I hear their profits are up so somebody likes it.

The service and food is unacceptable I was seated for a whole hour just to get a burger with blonde hair on it! After taken back to the kitchen the waiter comes back with a burger uncooked which I didn't ask for! FYI, all cooks need to wear hairnets at all times! It's totally sickening and disgusting to receive that type of service. Didn't even get a response back from the Manager for this horrible service! Pay attention to your food, going to Red Robin is a waste of your time!

I love red robin but was totally disappointed and left and went to islands down the street. Why ::: called 3 minutes before walked in and was told no wait and not busy that was a laugh, had a waiting list, waited 15 minutes and left. Young lady and man hostess desk were cocky and could care less. Place was very noisy and area was far from clean. Very disappointment I live for there burger, to bad.

The food here remains excellent! The service today was wonderful. However, the restaurant inside looks like the Elephant Bar just moved out and Red Robin moved in. Very un-interesting. So, why the 2 stars? I came in by myself today, and quickly discovered that even in today's day and age, there was no WiFi. Really? With the prices the way they are, I think this is pretty stinky! However, what really concerned me was that when I turned my WiFi service (Verizon) off, I was unable to get any OTA data service. I went outside and before I went 20feet, the service returned. Apparently, Red Robin is filtering the service, and as the bartender indicated, the restaurant doesn't want customers "camping out". Hard to believe, but either the restaurant is indeed affecting the signal, which is not easy, or there is a real problem with that building. And the shared cell tower is adjacent to the shopping center. (Shared means being used by more than one mobile carrier) So if you're a Doctor, Lawyer, or Candle Stick maker, and you need access....other than a simple phone call....you might want to eat somewhere else, or at least inquire before being seated. IMHO.

I would give it more stars based on just the waiter but everything else was awful.  Will not return again.  Small portions, waited for 45 minutes for soup and salad and expensive for bad quality food.  Does anyone like this place?  It's busy but don't know why.  Sad to see such a great space be taken by such an awful establishment.

Came to try out the new location. The food was good the service and lighting not so good. Took forever for our food. The lights at the tables in the bar area are super bright. Our server was super sweet but it took forever for our food to come out.

Personally I like this spot a lot better than the old location. The old one felt dirty and outdated. This one is much more up to date and not nearly as dark. The food is still good so I'm not sure why people are giving this location 2 stars just because "it looks like they didn't even change the layout of the elephant bar" why would they? The building was designed to work in such a way that changing it wouldn't make sense.  I will definitely eat here more often now that they are out of that old dirty spot tucked in the old dark corner of the mall next to Sears.

Came in a couple nights ago because our son was excited to try the new location.  We were seated right away and our server took our drink and app order within five minutes.  Our initial impression was, as others have said, looks like the Elephant Bar moved out and Red Robin moved in, not much of a floor plan change.  Got out drinks and appetizer, the stacked onion rings.  Hot, crispy and coated with panko bread crumbs with a side of ranch and BBQ.  Our son got a cheeseburger, wife got the avocado chicken salad and I got the D.G.B. (Oven-roasted tomatoes, roasted garlic aioli and fresh arugula tossed in citrus olive oil dressing on a toasted ciabatta bun).  This was not a bad burger, good balanced flavors except it was really greasy, couple that with the aioli and the burger literally slid off the bun. As we were eating, the restaurant reminded me of the old Farrell's Ice Cream restaurant, loud and bright with lots of kids running around.  In fact, at the table next to us was a family with two kids and one was happily banging on the table with her forks while mom just sat there eating.

Went to newly opened location and it is absolutely filthy.  It's really unappealing to be seating in a restaurant that had food and garbage all over the tables and floors.  Clearly management needs more help at this location as the manager was cleaning the tables as I wrote this review.  People expect quality service and hospitality when dining out.  Please try harder next time.

Been eating at the one at the mall for years and it moved locations and got new staff and now other things are suffering. We have been here twice and last time the service wasn't bad and the food was ok. So we decided to chalk it up to a new opening. This time two orders were wrong out of four. Orders of fry refills were ignored. Fries were burnt. Drinks remained empty. Not sure I want to bother coming back.
Very very slow service for a weeknight, the burgers and drinks are always good but even that cant make up for the abysmal service.

Placed a phone order to be picked up at 245 the other day. Was on a lunch break and was pressed for time. Had to wait until 305 to finally get my order. Employees were polite, but seriously could have done a better job at keeping through with their promises on phone order pick up times.  Food was cold and not that great. Management needs to seriously step it up on this establishment.

We have been to this new location twice. We had a wait both times but the food was hot and fresh. Not sure why all the bad reviews I think with the new location there are always going to be growing pains but we had a great experience both times. I highly recommend the chicken ensalada platter
Horrible food, horrible service, dirty, bad-for-your-health. Avoid. Lots of other options.

New location is nice looking. Food...I should've known to stick with the staples. Fried pickles-greasy (old or burned). Crab cake burger - bun soaked in grease. Cake watery and mushy obviously frozen and really noting redeeming. Ramen burger was tasty but server forgot the side aioli we requested. New location same poor experience.

Aahh I do not know about this new Red Robbin. Right now, me and my daughter are still waiting for our orders. It takes forever. It's bad enough already to wait more than 30 minutes as what we are originally told 20 minutes wait. The fact that they have plenty of table available when we were finally given our table. This restaurant manager is really, really bad includin the staff. Unvelievable our food just being served. OMG!

Had very high expectations but was let down.  We came in for lunch and just after opening.  There was no one there and we were told it would be 5 minutes for a table?  Just let us sit at one of the many open tables and bring us some drinks.  Don't really understand the wait.  We sat down and ordered some cheese curds!  This is the only reason for two stars,  they were great.  I ordered a blue cheese burger.  It was greasy but fairly tasty.  If you are a gourmet burger place then they should not be ok they should be excellent.   Lazy dog has a much better black and blue burger.   As for the bottomless sides.   I was offered a refill when the food was brought out because it took so long.  I finished my entire plate and still waited for the side to come out.   I guess they can offer bottomless because they drag their feet so slowly that you will finally leave out of frustration.  If I make a gourmet burger I use 75% lean which is the fattest ground beef you can get.  When I am done eating my homemade burger I feel great.  I walked out of red robin feeling like I drank a large glass of deep frier grease.  The burger was just dripping grease.   The bottom bun was completely saturated with grease.  Not acceptable for a place that is new and specializes in gourmet burgers.   Food.  2 stars Service 2 stars Atmosphere 4 stars I will not be returning.   Too many good to great options to eat around here.

I haven't eaten at Robin in over 20 years and didn't expect much, but I was pleasantly surprised. The fish and chips were very well done with flaky, moist white fish under a nearly greaseless fried batter. The side order of equally greaseless sweet potato fries was delicious and enough to feed a table of 3 even though it was under $5 I believe. I expected the worst based on the reviews here but our waitress was friendly and attentive, the wait not too bad, and the diner style food was really good.  Until this visit, the reason why I stopped easting at places like Red Robin is due to cleanliness issues. Many places like this usually look clean, but if you grab the plastic menu standing at the table or reach a condiment, your fingers usually run over some sort of greasy film unseen yet felt. That kind of thing turns me off right away. This was NOT the case at this Red Robin and I only hope that that is not because it is new. Food and service is important but even with all that I cannot eat comfortably if I feel like I'm sitting in the middle of a greasy film. Keep it up Red Robin, I will be back.

Food is great, however, service is slow and awful... I think the manager is the problem, he is young and probably inexperienced. The manager does not get things done, and does not help out real fast, he is very slow. Acts like he goes around and makes sure everything is okay, but does not do his best. But, love the personality on the waiters/waitresses, very polite and nice. Change the manager, keep the waiters/waitresses... This would help them succeed more, and have better service. :) Better shape up, or you will be gone.

Wait time: 30 mins  (on Father's day) Food wait: 20 min Only thing good was the onion ring stack and endless root beer float. Ordered:1 app, two kids meals, 2 drinks, and 2 burgers with fries. The bill came out to $62. I'm not returning. They nickel and dimed us for everything.  I asked for jalapeño on my burger,  and it was barely any on it (I counted 3 slivers). I was charged 99 cent. I ordered garlic fries (that's a 99 cent upgrade) very greasy. My husband wanted the chili sauce and that was 99 cent as well. The sangria is trash. It tasted like half wine and half water. No flavor at all. I asked for easy ice.... guess what.... yep... full of ice. I removed the ice and had less than half a drink. $5 wasted. I had a birthday burger reward that I couldn't use because they couldn't find it in their system. I logged in from my phone and pulled it up for them to see.... so it was there. My server asked her Manager to override it.... manager refused. I'm pissed. So they basically told me ain't no rewards bih. Ok.... we're done here. 1st and last time here. Trying to figure out how to delete my RR profile now. Done. No need for pics of the food. It is not as good as it use to be. Burgers were meh! And soggy. My kids enjoyed their pizza.  Oh my water was good.

The food was overall yummy, and you can never go wrong with unlimited fries. Our server was funny and nice, so that helped. A manager also checked in with us, showing great service. To agree with most of these reviews, the food did take a very long time, but at the same time the burgers my brothers ordered were delicious! The Clam Chowder soup was okay and the salad was also not the best. I understand that this is mostly a burger place, so overall I'd give it a 4/5.

Dirty. Poorly managed disaster. Until they remove management stay away.  Floors and tables were filthy three times we went.  I mean 5-12 filthy tables around the place had not been touched.  It's a 25-40 minute wait which could be very acceptable. Here's the rub - as you are waiting in lobby with just a few others for a Twin Peaks half hour, you are staring right at ten tables you could be sitting at IF THEY JUST CLEANED THE LAST GUESTS TRASH OFF.  I realize empty table does not equal getting seated. That's fine. But clean the trash off the tables we're all staring at for 30.  I patronized the RR 100 times at mall until the second or third time I saw feces on wall or changing table, toilets just blown up etc.  for several years I closed eyes to bathroom as they had mall traffic. Stopped going there eventually.  Was so excited when heard RR moving as I was sure they'd do it right. Couldn't wait for the most amazing fries, fish burger, cocktails etc. in a fresh clean new home. Nope. Same great cooks and menu destroyed by front house delivery.

Nothing different here. Just as dirty and sticky as the old location. Waiting a half an hour for a dirty table and I'm counting at least 11 empty tables why don restaurants do this? Anyway if your thinking your coming to a new clean Red robin think again and be patient took about 30 minutes to get 3 burgers. Come on Red Robin let's get it together.

So many problems... We took our son here for his 8th birthday. For some odd reason he's been wanting to try this place ever since it opened. Now I can this was his first and last time here. When we entered on a Monday afternoon, the entrance was full of families waiting to be seated. The hostess told us it would be a 30min wait, and so we sat closest to her so we can hear our name. After some time had passed, we noticed that families that came in after we did were being seated before us. We went up to the hostess that took over that shift and they said we weren't on the wait list anymore, and that our name was somehow removed. We voiced how upset we were and they seated us right away. As another hostess sat us, we asked her for a child's menu since they forgot to bring one for my son but she never brought one. Our regular waiter came and we had to ask him for it. Food: Over priced for such poor quality. The bottom of my burger bun was soaked with oil. My son ordered the kids cupcake shake because the picture in the menu looked so delicious, but when it came it wasn't even filled to the top. The top was mostly whip cream and sprinkles.  The worst part is that our son mentioned to the waiter that it was his birthday, but they never came to sing to him. They did sing to the other table next to us though. This place is horrible. You can get better service at a drive through or a hot dog stand. I would give this place 0 stars if possible.

Been here a couple times but will not go back.  20 minutes to get a burger that was burnt even though I ordered it as medium.  Even the fries tasted old and soggy.  Walked in at 11:55 and walked out at 12:30.  Very disappointing.  Spoke briefly with the manager telling him I would not be paying, stood up and left.

I went there last week with a friend for lunch. Wait time 15 mins. Had to wait awhile for our server, and we ordered a bottle of white wine. She came back 10 mins later to tell us it had to be chilled down. (Most whites should already be chilled down) we then had to order a bottle which was $10 more a bottle...no compensation offered. The salad my friend ordered was too big for the plate. Food also took awhile, then I asked for a box, which never showed up. This was my 2nd time there....not going back

We came to celebrate my husbands bday...we came on a Saturday around 5pm and we were a party of 5...waited only 5min before we were seated. Server was great, took our order and food was out in no time. The food was great..tasted great! I like this new location...the atmosphere is great if you have kids or if you don't.
Not impressed! Mediocre service and the same for the food.  I ordered the open-faced chili burger with a salad. The salad wasn't cold or very crispy. The burger was skimpy.  I wouldn't rush back.

Very disappointed in the wait time and the quality of food. First time we visited this new site and will not be back for awhile. Grilled cheese that fell on the floor still under our table when we sat down and the restaurant in general was not kept clean.  The restaurant didn't appear full but our food took a long time. When our food finally came My husbands garden burger came out wrong so they had to remake it which took another 10-15 minutes. It still wasn't right the 2nd time around but he just ate it because he was starving by this time and just wanted to eat and leave We could hear the other tables complaining as well about the wait time for their food. The kids meal came out on these tiny little plates and their fries where sitting on top of the pizza. Common sense to use a bigger plate? We had high hopes for the new location but sadly won't be back for awhile. Hopefully management will make some changes soon.

The food is great, as always, but other than that there's nothing. They seemed to be understaffed and every time I've gone I've seen multiple people complaining to the owner about poor service.  It also doesn't have the classic Red Robin atmosphere like the old location, so it's kind of just boring. I can tell that they're trying to make it modern and what not but it just turned out dark and bland. There isn't the same fun/joyful feeling like the old location had. I used to enjoy the bright colors and all of the rad stuff on the walls. Now it's all black and barely has any paintings or decorations..

Terrible terrible terrible.  Walked in on a Thursday evening. Wait was ten minutes or open seating at the bar. We chose the bar. There were about 5 tables available but all were dirty. We waited for a good 15 mins with no assistance, although the snooty female server walked passed us numerous times and didn't say hi, ask to take the order or clean the table. Out of frustration we asked to be seated in the dining area and got seated right away.  Our server Daniel was great. Attentive and friendly. He notified us that we could take care of the tab using the tablet on the table when we were ready. I didn't blame him as it was starting to get late and we were almost done. Problem was, we were paying cash and needed someone to provide change for the difference. We hit the "call server" button on the Tablet that flashes red.  10 SERVERS! Literally, 10 servers walked past us, even looked at the blinking light and never stopped to ask if we needed anything. Yes, I counted. The 11th person finally stopped and we were finally able to get out of there. Was not impressed and prob won't be back for a while. Place is understaffed, very messy and slooooow. Get it together Red Robin!

A long wait to get served. After ordering two salads, it took another 45 minutes for them to arrive, and then they were rather poor quality. After repeatedly asking the waiter for the status of our order, he blamed the kitchen.  I did return for another lunch, as I thought it might have been an anomaly and surely they could make good burgers. The Blue Cheese burger took 30 minutes, and they failed to cook it medium rare as i requested-- it was medium. The waiter said that they only make burgers "slightly pink" or "not pink." Worse, the meat had an odd texture, like they had ground it too finely; that is, it had no texture at all! It was a rather gross homogeneous mass. Furthermore, my blue cheese burger had no blue cheese on it; I had to ask the waiter to bring some. The onion rings and the milk shake were good, though.  But how can it be a "gourmet burger" if they don't cook it to order? Maybe their kitchens are run by lawyers instead of cooks. Lots of small children present at lunch. Maybe it's a good venue for families, except wouldn't small children get cranky waiting 45 minutes for a meal? Dunno, but I'm not returning!

Great!!!!!   Thrilled it opened!!! Has a great Happy Hour menu !!  Just across parking lot. It is totally great!!!!! They always have great food & prices.  Thrilled it is here.  Great for the neighborhood!!! Life is soooo good & they are awesome!!!

This Red Robin just relocated to the old Elephant Bar restaurant building and it still looks like that old restaurant except it's now grey and red inside instead of jungle theme. The layout is still the same and I swear some of the wall art is from the old E.B. days. The booths in the back still have wobbly tables and smell like stale grease.  Food is meh and the service was mediocre.  Won't be going back.

The worst new location but food sucks drinks suck bar tender blonde curly hair no name tag sucks 5 workers in front not working flirting with each other's Santa Clarita needs good restaurant this one hate it

I rarely write a negative review, but feel compelled, only because I hope that someone who has any type of ability to make change may read this.  I want to preface that I do not by any means blame the front line servers, hosts, runners, bartenders etc. for the lack of quality, nor the lack of efficiency of the restaurant. I have now made multiple visits to the new location, and have been disappointed on each occasion.  I can deal with the wait time, as it is a new location and people are excited to visit, my only recommendation  here would be to offer a "call ahead" seating type option, or an option where you could put yourself on the waiting/guest list through the use of an app on smartphone or tablet.  The challenge starts when you are initially seated.  It takes quite a while to receive any attention and although there is an ability to order items on the table top device, you can't use it until you place an initial order through one of the servers at which time it becomes activated.  I don't blame the servers for the exuberant wait times on receiving service, which also leads into wait times on receiving drinks/food/refills etc.  it seems that the restaurant is completely understaffed, not to the fault of any of the front line employees, and I would even go as far to say the management of the particular establishment/. I am assuming this issue is created from a budgetary standpoint or someone who received a bonus off of the P&L, or some type of employee productivity measure.  This is unfortunate as in the long term it will be extremely difficult to keep both guests happy and retain quality employees, once the nostalgia of a "new place" wears off.  It is imperative to provide guests with not only a quality product, but quality service, which in all actuality can make a far bigger impact than the product being offered.  My ask is that whoever may make decisions look at the long term outlook, and asses the opportunity to staff the restaurant properly to provide a better guest experience. The food is what you would expect, although the kitchen gets extremely backed up and I have had to send items back each time for coming out cold, once again I don't blame the front line, this will happen when there aren't enough servers, expediters, food runners, etc.!  The same goes for beverage service, it takes an extremely long time to obtain a refill on any type of beverage, and even longer for an alcoholic beverage.  The appearance of the new restaurant is far more in line with a modern environment than the previous restaurant located at the Town Center Mall.  The issue I have here is that it is not properly maintained.  The menus, and table tops are sticky, the floor is not well swept/mopped, even the window sills have a layer of dust.  I know it gets busy, but once again, this can have an effect on long term success/failure of a business, and can easily be addressed. This review is not meant to bash the establishment.  I am more than happy to share further feedback with someone who may be interested in hearing it.  Please feel free to reach out to me.  I hope to see some positive change which will help with the long term success of this restaurant.

Had to wait 40 mins for food to be brought to table. Food arrived cold, bread was soggy, burger meat was burnt and orders were wrong. We asked to speak to the manager three times before he actually came to the table. When he came to table, he said "I know you are upset. We took too long. I have no excuses."  I appreciate the honest acknowledgment,  however, food was still cold and order was not corrected. Skip this place and go instead to the other restaurants across the parking lot.

My experience is during Happy Hour on a weekday after 9pm. There was ample bar seating, which was good because I was expecting it to be packed. The Happy Hour menu for food and drinks were good and inexpensive. For two people, we spent about $16(plus tip). My boyfriend likes red bull with a certain drink, but the bar does not carry red bull (called ahead of time to ask). So we snuck a can in ;)

Sad hype. Visited this past week during lunch time with my wife. Half empty. All the seats have cold vents blowing above, one way or another. It would be perfect if the place was near full like most Red Robins, perhaps it is to keep you awake for the SLOW service.  Server was friendly, but the food was just ok and the fries were in their original frozen state, except someone had "cooked" them in between. Did I mention SLOW service. Our tiny meals were a disappointment. Having to ask for "regular" things; straws, etc. just to complete our meal is unacceptable and ridiculous.  The place already needs a thorough cleaning. Floors aren't clean, tables are sticky with used gum underneath! Portions are SMALL. I get paying for a location but do you really need to make your willing customers upset? I don't see this place lasting long this way. The hype was for a great new familiar restaurant in town. BIG letdown.
Service extremely slow. And it wasn't busy. Took forever to get food and refills. All the ingredients in the chicken wrap are diced too small and fall out as you eat it.

BEWARE SANTA CLARITA...Absolutely the worst decision to move this restaurant from the mall...we waited 15 minutes to be sited and as we were walking to our table some Rude server decided to walk right in front of me; then I visited the Very filthy bathrooms and we got to wait 50 minutes for a hamburger and fish and chips that tasted nothing like what we were accustom to...very dry and unflavored hamburger. We will NEVER GO BACK

This was my first time at their new location, and I was not extremely impressed. We waited longer than expected for our table and then for our food after ordering. Our food took one hour to come out, and all we ordered were burgers! The food: Sautéed 'Shroom Burger: 4/5, The mushrooms were not cooked as well as I am used to. However, the burger meat was flavorful and fresh; and the cheese was melted perfectly! Overall a great, simple burger.  Burnin' Love Burger: 4/5, what a tasty burger! The meat was cooked very well, and all the vegetables were fresh. The chipotle aioli really complemented salsa and pepper-jack cheese. Very flavorful burger! Cheesecake: 2/5, the cheesecake was extremely difficult to eat. The filling was too hard to even get on the fork. However, the crust was nice and buttery.  Gooey Chocolate Brownie Cake: 1/5, the chocolate brownie cake was dry and too sweet. It tasted like those microwaveable cakes you get at the store. Very disappointing.  Service: 5/5, unfortunately I do not remember our server's name, but he was very sweet! Even though our food didn't come out as fast as we would've liked, he definitely saved the night. He checked on us constantly (even though he was very busy) and kept reassuring us that our food would be out as soon as possible.  Overall, the food is pretty good (however, I would suggest Cold Stone next door for better dessert)! And the service is excellent!
SLOW!!! Food was good (not great) but service was so slow.  On the plus side the new location looks nice.

So let me first start off by saying that I've tried giving Red Robin a chance but this place really needs to change. I really believe that they need new management and employees who are actually willing to work instead of having an attitude that they don't want to be there. In my opinion they won't last long at the new location and something better should replace it. Now onto my second complaint. I am no twig or skinny girl. I have quite some meat on my bones and when I followed the hostess to our table I could not fit my butt! I fit in all other booths at other restaurants but at Red Robin it was like squeezing play dough through your teeth! I have a sense of humor about it so I laughed and the hostess sat us at a table but Red Robin, come on!! My twig sister and my brother who is physically fit barley had any room! Its uncomfortable for any normal human. I'm sure they are just trying to squeeze as much people in but lets be real here!! I will have to pass on Red Robin from now on. PS The parking sucks

The gluten free menu is a pain. One must use a filthy  screen to order when the rest of the menus are paper. The chef sent my smokey gfree burger on a bun! Waited another 15 + minutes for a new burger- while the rest of my family was already asking for more fries (which took forever to arrive). I then realized my burger was missing the pickles. The burger was drowned in ketchup sauce- and way too kuch lettuce for a wrap.  The waitress acted put out the entire time until the end after she finally said the chef was "off" today. Kids menu is cheap, but now I know why- very tiny portions. Should be for 6 and under,not 12. My first and last time to RR. I've been told the old menu is much better. As a celiac, I depend on the gfree menu to be trustworthy.

I gotta say I am disappointed once again at the new location and service.  This was my second time at this restaurant and have always been a big fan of Red Robin.  I hope corporate pays attention to these reviews so they can incorporate the necessary changes based on customer feedback and satisfaction.   First-the French fries are way undercooked both times had to send them back and took forever for our food.  Second-took my daughter to the restroom (did not pay the bill yet) half our meal still on the table, came back to an empty table. Then had to wait for it to come back out and I asked for it to go, manager came back with food on plates,  I told her situation and she says,  sorry.   Third- ordered a salad platter to go,  come home to a tiny portion I have ever seen for a meal. For a $13 meal.   Fourth- the servers need to be retrained and more attentive to the needs of the customers.  When your drink is empty and they pass your table not that frequently by the way, they should  have another drink for you, or work as a team and have other servers assist.   I hope this gets to the right people to please make changes or this place will not last long.   Lousy service, mediocre food, untrained staff, very disappointed.

This Red Robins replaced Elephant Bar. I came here with a friend and it was extremely crowded. Because we felt that the wait was going to be long we asked for menus to look at so we could decide what to eat right when we sat down. Good thing was that the wait wasn't too long because it was just a friend and me. If you come in a large party be prepared to wait a bit. We were seated at the bar and the service was a bit lacking. We ordered the chili cheese fries while she got the guacamole burger. The food was alright but the burger came with barely any guacamole. We were slightly disappointed. The fries were decent and had some jalapeño slices on top of the fries so it gave a good kick of spice. I thought we had a cool server because she was nice in the beginning but I was a bit bummed at the end when we asked for to go boxes and didn't get them in time. I understand she's busy so we asked another server to get us the boxes and when our original server saw us with the to go boxes already she gave us an apology but she didn't seem genuine about it. But that's okay, once again, I understand that servers always have a lot on their plate. It's very stressful handling crazy customers. TL;DR Come here just for the Red Robin's food and experience but don't expect high class treatment. Probably good for high school years.

Food is good but service sucks which, if I remember correctly, played a large role in why my family and I quit going when it was still over at the mall. I'd really hoped that with the switch of location some of the issues we'd been experiencing might've been addressed but was disappointed when we went for diner recently. We had purposely waited until a little later in the night to head over thinking we'd beat the crowd so we we be in and out pretty quick. We chose to sit in the bar area which is open seating. We were more or less able to walk right in and sit down. It ended up taking about ten minutes for someone to take or drink order, then another ten or so to get our three sodas and glass of wine (mind you we were sitting in the BAR AREA). We finally got our drinks and places our orders for food. That had to have taken *at least* another 40 minutes or so while the woman at the next table over (I kid you not) whips out several bottles of nail polish, sets them on her table, and begins giving herself a mani in the middle of the bar while she waited for the remainder of her party to get there. Once they did they proceeded to have the loudest (and frankly most entertaining) convo ever. I was considering giving them another chance, but not if all these other reviews are anything to go off of.
Love taking the kids here for lunch. The staff have always been friendly and are attentive to the kids. The burgers and drinks are good value. I'm happy they moved to this new location.

Where do I start? I'll start with the hostess, the face of Red Robin when you first arrive.  Sam looked and acted like she wished she was someplace else.  She made Wednesday Adams look like Mary Poppins. She should not be greeting guests.  I actually like Red Robin, but if this was my first time I would never come back.  For a new store the seats were broken and dirty.  The fries tasted kind of sour like they were made with old oil.  We ordered two Royal Red Robin burgers and I'm pretty sure they are supposed to have bacon. Neither of the two burgers we ordered had bacon.  Such a disappointment.  I might be willing to chalk it up to a bad night, everyone can have a bad night but it will be quite a while before I come back.

The atmosphere was very nice, even though you can still see some of the resemblance of the Elephant Bar. The wait wasn't too long to be seated & the staff was very friendly. The food took a little long & they messed up on one order, but quickly fixed it.  We felt the food was average in taste, but not bad.

Having to wait 30 minutes while there are numerous empty tables is ridiculous. Food was OK. Steak fries were dry and hard. Burger ok. Good option for kids $5 for drink, meal and endless sides.  Bad option for parents.
A little disappointed. Food was not that great. Burger seemed like the make at home burgers from Costco, the frozen ones!.  The turkey burger same thing. Will most likely not return.

The worst service ever! The wait for the food was so long, not to mention even waiting for the waiter. When we got our food we had no utensils and has to wait for those. There was no sauces or condiments in our burgers but to even ask for their would be even longer and we were already hungry. Due to the so so good and lack of service I don't think we will be back.

Just check out their new location, wasn't impressed. My friend and I went because we were craving a good chicken burger as we remember they have one of the best, we waited 15 minutes for drinks and another 15 for food. When we got our burgers they were cold. The burgers were average at best and service was terrible. The waitress came back like every 25 minutes or so. We ended up having dinner here for 2 hours because the waitress forgot about us and was so slow. Check it out for yourself but beware service isn't great and food is average at best.
Not a terrible meal. Went here around lunch with some friends. Expensive food, burger wasnt bad. Steak Fries were hard and not fresh. But sweet potato fries were better.  What i expected more or less
As always food was delish, chicken burger for me and chicken fingers for son. Service was exceptional; thanks Taaron! You rock!

Where do I begin. Asked to be seated outside then was given an excuse about no server. Floor was super dirty. Very slow service, on top of asking multiple times for condiments. Got a burger well done. Was pink inside. They took it back and literally threw it on the grill for a few more minutes and was still pink inside. Got soup, well that ended up coming at the end of the meal. As we left noticed many people waiting to be seated even tho there were tons of open tables. I will never go back. No one seemed to really care about the service from the hostess, waitress, and cook. Very disappointed! Would not go back and would not recommend.

I ordered a few items for take out- the server told me it would take about 20 minutes... I showed up and paid on time, and then waited for over an hour for my order to be delivered (only a few kids meal items). This restaurant needs to get its act together.

I went to this place and I must say, from the moment I walked in, I was greeted by a very kind hostess. She sat me and my kids and gave them balloons. They were so happy. I believe her name was Sam. Excellent customer service and great atmosphere! Overall...a 10 in my book. I think the hostess should be serving not seating people because She was very nice!

I am delighted there is a new restaurant in the Valencia area. So many have failed in the area. We need to give a new restaurant that is only 4 months old all chance to get over the hurdle of new employees and a new location. They have a very wonderful menu.  I do wish they did not put a speaker above every single table that cannot be turned down. The service was good but the kitchen staff was horrible. Apparently the cook thought it would be funny to send the waitress back to the table to tell us that they were out of chili. She had to come back and apologize because it was only a joke. Ordered 2 medium Burgers but one came well done. The Tomato Burger ordered with extra tomatoes came with one scrawny slice of tomato. Also the wrong sides came out. But that was all caused by 1 crummy cook who still doing his job and apparently not taking seriously the value of having one. The rest of the staff was extremely polite and apologetic and responsive. It is now mandatory that you use the table top checkout screen. I find them impersonal and irritating plus prone to errors. Really!! Sense I refused to use a kiosk to pay for a sit-down meal I need to pay in cash if I ever intend on returning. What an inconvenience.

Worst bar service I've had in mimute!! Seriously, waited for thirty minutes to get a happy hour drink and when my drink was empty tenders passed by multiple times and NEVER was asked for another!  My party had to literally flag people down and then waited over an hour to get another. This was a Friday, too. Completely understaffed and the staff had no idea who's orders were who's. Don't waste your time!!!!!

When this place was in the mall the service & food was much better.  We've been here three times since they moved and it's been downhill since.  Today, 40 minutes for drinks, 50 for food and they got 75% of our order wrong. Not even a refill on the drinks!

Do not go here!!! Save your money and time. Our service was terrible. It took us 20 minutes for our server to approach us and 40 minutes for our food to arrive. My chicken sandwich was extremely dry. Our drinks were not refilled and our order of fries never arrived. The prompt on the table for call server is absolutely useless. Should have gone to In and Out!!!

Showed up As they opened. It wasn't very busy at all. Seated right away. The service was below standard. We had to keep stopping the waiter for refills, not once did he check up on us. We had to stop him for everything. And EVERYTHING took forever. He was also very awkward Towards us. Not very personable. Food was mediocre as always.

After eating at the mall location many times over the years, last night We finally tried the new location. The poor service experience was the same as what's already been mentioned in previous reviews. Food seems to also have taken a step down and I'm sad to say 3 out of 4 people in our household became sick within an hour of eating there, probably from improperly stored and/or improperly cooked meat. Thankfully our home has lots of bathrooms...we've needed all of them for the last 24 hours. This will be our last visit to Red Robin and my hunch is that this location will be empty by year end.

Where do I begin?  Had high hopes knowing that this particular Red Robin is fairly new.  As we were being seated, the hostess walked us right past a huge spill and seemed completely oblivious to it.  As I followed her I noticed that the bottom of my shoes were now sticky.  Then she showed us our table which had food on the seat. Looking around I saw several tables that hadn't been bussed which wasn't necessarily unusual except they remained that way for the next 15 minutes. When I went to the restroom a little girl was quickly backing out of a stall announcing that there was poop on the floor.  Thankfully I didn't see that before my meal. The restaurant in general had great decor and my server was very cordial and attentive.  My main issue was that the place just wasn't very clean and no one seemed to realize it or care.  Even as I'm writing this is looked up and noticed that a central carpeted area has food all over the floor.  I've seen Hometown Buffets cleaner than this. Who knows...maybe this was an off night and it will get better.  But if you try this place...whatever you do don't order the wings!  Tasted like somebody dumped a box of salt into the sauce!

Ok Sunday night I know it's busy but last week I was at Cheesecake Factory where it was even busier.  Service here is on life support.  I bring up Cheesecake Factory because clearly they were twice as swamped and our food and request came in adequate time.  Last night we decided to try the new location. RIP Elephant Bar.  We were always pleased eating here when it was at the mall.  Initial wait was 30 min which is understandable on a holiday weekend prime time.  A bit concerning when I see empty clean tables. Clearly the amount of staff was not able to handle.  But ok, we get our seat ordered our food with a few requested side items to have with our dinner.  Upon arrival of the food my wife asked where inept the side items were.  The food runner said she will get it.  Never came. Then we asked the server.  It's just a side of BBQ that my wife wanted on her burger.  Another 10 min go by and she finished her burger.  Finally she gives her the sauce to an empty plate.  Other items we ordered came later.  Such as my daughters milk shake, which by the way was the wrong flavor. Since we were so hungry and half way through the meal we didn't bother to call her out on it. Endless fries is a plus but that also took a very long time for a re-order. The server seemed very stressed.  Not sure if it's the volume but as a previous food service worker you got to increase your staff.  A good manager will create a solid team     Such as a food runner, servers and bus staff to clean tables and tend to minor customer requests.  I am all for second chances so that new place can get the ball rolling. If these reviews are read by Mang please step it up.  I know servers need experience but some need a lesson maintaining professionalism and organization.  I know this is not Cheesecake Factory or Ruth Criss but honestly I seen a better organized staff T Dennys.

1st time the service was horrible!! Waiters walk away from you as they are taking your order. Service was slow!!  Blah blah blah.  I thought, well they just opened so I'll give it another try. Went back today and still was horrible. Although our server was really nice it was still very slow and so much for bottomless fries. It took 20 minutes for another round. Brought us the wrong drinks. Messed up on one of our entrees. I think it's just understaffed and could use some more liveliness!! To be honest I think it was better when it was in the mall. Won't be going back

I don't normally dine at 2 Star Restaurants but since I was already there  I pulled out my phone and to my surprise 2 stars Omg! I rarely eat burgers but I shared one with my hubby.  He got the New Buzz Mac N Cheese tavern Burger. Sorry to say it was not good, tasteless. Mac N Chesse tasted like it came straight out of a box.  I gave them 3 star because our waitress was exceptional, Shout out to Emma.
Going out of my way to let y'all know this place sucks my burger was so small like a whopper Jr., service was w.e save your money and go to 5 guys or INNout,

I would give 0 stars but I can't.  So I give them 1.  We sat down at 702. Waiter popped by at 712p said I will be back in a moment.  Finally came back took drunk order.  Now at 742 I had one lemonade no sign of waiter. Oh did I say it's my birthday. This place is bad

I've liked other Red Robins.  But the service at this place is horrible.  It's INCREDIBLY slow.  It took forever to order, get food, and get the check.  On top of that, the bottomless fries were stale.  And although they're bottomless in theory, in practice you'll die from old age long before you get a second helping. I would definitely not recommend this place.

I went to this new burger place last Sunday, around 11:45 am.  When I got inside the restaurant, I was greeted with an enthusiastic receptionist.  I informed her that I am ordering to go.  She handed me the colorful menu and in 2 minutes I was ready to order.  The receptionist went inside to inform the server about the take out order.  I waited patiently and ask the receptionist if I will be helped shortly.  Poor receptionist, she has to go back inside 3 times to ask the server to come out and get the order.  The server informed the receptionist that she had to complete an order before she can get another order.  The restaurant was not busy at that time, maybe just 10 customers.  I could not wait any longer and informed the receptionist that they should check out Woodranch take-out procedure.  Woodranch take out counter are always ready, quick and efficient.  I expect the same or better service from this new burger place.  I have to hold off my imagination of that gourmet burger. I wonder that if I call in my order for pick up, will they answer the phone?
We've eaten at various Red Robin locations over the years.  We really enjoyed this visit.  The server was very friendly and enthusiastic.  We are moving to the area so we would definitely return.

Horrible service, servers are very unattaintive.  They don't care about costumers because the tip is pre-calculated with the bill.  So it doesn't matter if the server/s renders a good or sloppy service, they still get the tip that they don't disserve.  I will never come back to this place anymore ever.
Service was mediocre. Food remnants littered the floor. Like kids are dropped stuff on the floor and it was never cleaned up. Nice new location service is bad.

I had below a mediocre experience with Red Robin in Valencia. The food was a bit bland: The bun is mushy and the meat patty just plainly disgusting. Also, the server was very rude and gave us really awful fries. And when we asked her to change them she pretty much scolded us and took about twenty minutes to get new ones. The food being bland was way easier to handle. The number one important thing at dinner, besides being with loved one, is service.

Tried this restaurant on a Saturday around 6pm. Was very happy to see the place kinda crowded.  Sat at the bar. Very impressed - was able to get a seat and the bartender Toni was awesome! Good food and great drinks! We will definitely be going back again soon.
Shit food. Shit service. Shit prices. Even the waiter said "Im over this restaurant." Never coming back.

Only so i can put in a review, my wife and i stopped into our local red robin. We figured the bar would be fast considering Friday night. We sat down at a high top next to the actual bar. Sat for 15 minutes was passed by several server/bar tenders they even went to the table behind us. We were not greeted, asked our drink order or even made eye contact. We left.

Rude hostess with a nasty attitude! What is up with Red Robin?  Manager, Mark was not cool when I tried to explain how bad it was. I predict with him as the manager and those hostess this place will close soon. I swear the manager needs to learn how to deal with his public! Bad choice to give this place a chance w a new look. My introduction from the get go made dinner not fun! Great server name , Brez saved the night! Racist manager and 2 HOstess against Asian's!

2 stars and that's being nice.   Service - All I have to say is whoever is training the employees needs to do a better job.  Also, this place has too many employees.   The waitress who took our order was nice and polite.    Food -  It took about 20-30 minutes to get food.  This place wasn't even a 1/4 full.  The food (burger/fries) looked good and would've tasted better if it were HOT.   The food temperature was room temperature.  The only thing good was the cold beer.    If this place did the basics, I guarantee this place would make a grip.   Take a look at The Habit or In-N-Out.    At the rate Red Robin in Valencia is going....   give a year max!!  Bye bye

This place has gone so downhill since it left the mall. The burgers were unspeakable. They didn't even look like the ones on the menu and they tasted terrible. I paid $10 for a hamburger that was lower quality than something I could get at Carl's Jr. Never going back.

Just stopped into their new location for a bite to eat and wait out the horrendous traffic on the 5 before heading home on a Sunday night. My wife and I both enjoyed the different ambiance and seating of this location versus the standardized Red Robin seating arrangement.  It felt a little more relaxed and not so crowded: there were no tables surrounding us as we sat in a more comfortable booth. The menu, the food, the service is all the same as any other Red Robin. Our server was pleasant but seem a bit preoccupied and forgot to bring my wife her beer and the rest of our silverware/napkins until she asked for it as our meals were being brought to us. The only negative I can state at this location was the carpet located in upper seating/booth area where we dined.  There was probably a whole day's worth of food and other debris scattered throughtout the area. It really doesn't take much effort or labor to run a carpet sweep over the area.

Most recent reviews predict this place won't make it.  I agree with them. Went late on Sunday afternoon around 3:15pm. There was no one in the waiting area.  I walked up to the host and hostess and apparently I rudely interrupted their very important personal conversation. Strike one. No greeting or "Welcome to Red Robin".  Just a look of contempt from the host named Ty.  I asked for a table for 5 and was told there was a 15 minutes wait. Bizarre since the place wasn't very busy and there was no one in the waiting area.  Ok. Fine. Not sure why, but I can deal with 15 minutes.  Next the Ty person says "Give me your cell phone number" with such an attitude that I snap back with the same and say "Why?!" He looks at me like we are going to fight or something, and then says "we'll text you when your table is ready".  I respond by pointing to a bench 5 feet away and tell him we will be right there. You know, the waiting area where there was no one else waiting except us? Strike two Once our name is called, the hostess just takes off.  Doesn't say anything nice, or look back to see if we are following, just takes off.  We were still by the host stand gathering the troops when she was at the booth in the back of the restaurant. She has to get back to her important conversation with the Ty person I guess. Strike three Place was not clean.  The floor has little food bits and trash strewn around. The booth we were given wasn't particularly clean.  The silverware had spots on it. Yuck. Strike four Of course they were out of the beers that I wanted so I just gave up and had water.  The previous treatment by the so called host and hostess along with the unclean feeling made me not order anything.  Food was slow to come out and refills required chasing down the server. The kids ate all their food and liked playing games on the little console that is at each table. Other than that, I don't have anything nice to say about the place. I don't plan on returning.

Came here the other night for a family dinner. Haven't been to a red robin in over 15 yrs at Glendale. First off, parking is good. Large lot, shares with other businesses but had no trouble finding a spot. Large outdoor entrance, and large inside entry. Lots of room for people to sit, stand and wait. There wasn't anyone waiting so we got seated right away by a hostess who was friendly. This place is big! Huge separate bar area, lots of 2 top booths and 4 top booths and a large center area that can be made up for large parties. And a separate other room with more seating. And TVs all over the place. The waitress greeted us and got the kids order and drink orders. They have a large kids menu, which is nice if u have kids because they are picky. So lots to chose from for them!  Took me a while to decide on food because they have a vast menu! Lots to choose from and lots of substitutions and bottomless options! They had so many choices of each thing, I couldn't decide which appitzer to order. Started with the onion rings tower. Which is like 10 fat sweet onions rings and comes with 2 dipping sauces. They were greasy and good.  I went with a bbq bourbon chicken sandwich. It was a good size and they didn't skimp on toppings. I got the bottomless garlic fries, which were very good. And they give u a small batch, and will quickly get u more when u ask. Which I liked because it keeps your fries hot. The Mrs got the garden burger which surprisingly tastes good! Good was fair priced for a restaurant.  I liked how they have the iPad kiosk thing on each table. Because if u want something right away and don't see your waitress you can enter it and the order goes thru. Same with paying, don't have to wait on a waitress to pay and leave.  The only complaints I have are the place seemed a bit dirty. Lots of food bits here and there. Which I know, it's normal in an eatery. But I'm not the first to mention it. And the service was friendly, but a bit slow. Burgers took a little while to show up and the place wasn't too busy. Other than that it was a decent experience. Great family place with lots of food options

Went again and sat in the bar this time.   The bartender was efficient, polite and quick. Ordered up a beer and the laadee ordered up some fruity something-or-the-other.  Both were good. Both ordered the app $3.00 Wedge Salad.  This salad is a steal.  It has a good size and has all the toppings you would need.  This salad puts the more expensive Wedge at Lucille's to shame. Also ordered the Four Cheese Melt, to split.  This is one damn good grilled cheese.  If you like grilled cheese, do yourself a favor and order this. With more visits, I can see this place receiving more stars.

The Whiskey River BBQ Burger is delicious and so are the Clucks and Fries. The only problem with this place is the service, it's terrible. They take forever to take your order and they take forever to deliver your order. In short, great food terrible service.

What else could go wrong? Not much. Here's the litany of the major problems... - 10 minutes to be seated in a half empty restaurant - 10 minutes until we saw our waitress - 10 minutes for drinks to arrive except a milkshake that took another 5-10 minutes - 20 minutes for food to arrive        - Missing soup - NO CUTLERY!       - Went to go to hostess station to request cutlery       - 5 minutes later - still no cutlery - Hostess station has 4 or 5 employees clustered around it.       - Found our waitress, asked for cutlery        - A few minutes later waitress shows up to drop off plastic to-go cutlery packs.        - The restaurant is out of forks, knives, and spoons! How does this happen?               - Perhaps some of the happy employees clustered around the hostess station could jump in and wash some?       - 10 minutes later the waitress returns to apologize that our soup had been sitting for 20 minutes, would we still like some?       - Soup arrives a few minutes later along with some real forks and knives.  The waitress up-sized the milkshake to apologize for the delay. The manager did comp the late soup. Long story short -  This is the worst managed restaurant I have ever visited!  The waitress had no support and was hung out to dry! There is no excuse for not having the basics! The manager clearly had no idea what was happening! This place won't last a year.  Oh yeah, the food was pretty tasty overall. But who wants to go through all that hassle?

Horribly managed, lots of open tables but they can't sit because they're understaffed. Tons of people waiting to be sat. Finally sat and no one showed up to even take a drink order. We had to ask for someone to be sent over. Waitress was nice but not her fault at all. Just a terribly run restaurant. Sadly I'll be surprised if it lasts.

This Red Robin just opened up a few months ago next to our place. I'd never been to a Red Robin before and didn't understand why there were lines of people waiting outside on a Saturday night. Were the burgers that good, or do we just live in a city that loves chain restaurants?  A few days ago, we got a mailer from Red Robin with a coupon. I thought this would be the perfect chance to try it. We arrived on a Saturday morning right when they opened at 11am. If you were old enough to sit in the bar, you were seated right away. If you had children and needed a regular table, you had to wait 15 minutes while the staff set up the tables (which is odd since i thought open for business meant that you'd be ready to seat people right when the doors open.  We sat at the bar and our waitress/bartender was super! She was attentive (even as more people started being seated) and sweet. I ordered a blue cheese burger (Bleu Ribbon) i think w sweet potato fries and garlic aioli. My bf ordered a regular gourmet cheeseburger with fries. My burger had to have been the worst blue cheese burger I'd ever eaten - ever... The flavor was not good, the bread was barely toasted, the crispy onions were no longer crispy... I couldn't finish it and I love burgers. The sweet potato fries were good, but the garlic aioli (which was extra) was not good. The free ranch dressing that came on the side was better. My bf was also unimpressed with the quality of the burger and fries.  We got our discount, paid at one of those kiosks at the table (which I hate and feel is incredibly impersonal, but I guess most chain restaurants are switching to them) and left. Overall, we won't be back. I'm glad I tried it, but if I've got a craving for burgers, I'll be down the street at Rustic Burger.

This is the second time I've visited Red Robin since they moved from the mall to their new location. Both times I have been disappointed. Today is Veteran's Day, so I understand that it was busy. My husband and I ordered French Onion soup to share, as an appetizer. By the time our entrees came, we had been sitting at our table for one hour. Very slow service and not very present waiter. As I said, I understand that it was busy (we waited 40 mins to be seated). Our server was cheerful and friendly, but it would've been nice if he had come by without me having to turn on the blinking light on the device  on our table to signal him or us flagging him down. Last time I came, the cheese on my burger was not warm and wasn't melted into my burger (the burger wasn't very hot when the cheese was added), and my sweet potato fries that I was so excited to try were COLD. They've gone down hill

This has to be the worst Red Robin of all. Poorly managed, severely understaffed. Restaurant was half full, but people were waiting forever to be seated. We were "lucky" enough beat the "rush" and were seated fairly quickly (10 minute wait to be seated in the almost empty side room). From the time we were seated, 20 minutes to get our order taken. 1 hour for our food to arrive after order taken. Food arrived cold but we had waited so long that we just ate the cold food. 20 minutes to get refills. Of  four appetizer plates, one was dirty and another was chipped. Management needs to consider people's time. Never again. To manager- get more servers, expos, runners, and dishwashers, and lose some people at the host stand.

Arrived at 11:45.  Seated right away.  Took several minutes before our waiter appeared.   No problem with the food, but our waiter never returned.  No refills offered.  Had to flag down a server to find our waiter to pay our bill.  Overcharge on our bill.  Several people at the hostess stand standing around.

Long time Red Robin customers... never again to this "new" Red Robin. Filthy, smelly, cold food. The floors, bathrooms and every surface are filthy. Employees sitting and drinking in the bar. Everybody hanging to talk to them. Tons of food in the window and when ours finally came COLD! French fries were so old they were shriveled. YUCK! My first glass of wine was in such a dirty glass that it had floaters of old food (?). I sent it back. Then our food came cold and we had to send it back. Finally, a manager came over and said she had been with Red Robin 6 years and we told Her our complaints and she apologized and rushed away to "clean up". Disappointed... that's how we left...

We thought we'd come back here since it's a new location. Bad idea.  Made us wait 20 mins to be seated when the place was EMPTY.  Put us in kid room that's dark and noisy.  My appetizer arrivedliterally five minutes before my meal. By which time there was no time to eat it because the main course was being served. Asked for my water FOUR times. It arrived at the END of my meal.  Food. COLD.  Never coming back. E. V. E. R.

Although there was a mistake on our order, the staff was very nice, genuine, and personalized our experience. I was mainly inclined to write this because at the end of our meal, we realized it started raining and storming very hard outside. One of the employees there named Ty was kind enough to voluntarily walk us out with an umbrella all the way to our car. He was so gracious, and without being asked he was beyond willing to help. Little things like this make up for any shortcomings in the "restaurant" experience itself. It shows true character and human decency when someone like Ty goes out of his way so willingly as he did. We really appreciate the service and thanks to Ty, I will be giving great recommendations!
Dirty place and mediocre food at best   Cold burger and cold fries. Actually flavorless burgers. Never going back.

If I could rate this a zero stars I would. The service here is a joke. Took them a half hour to take our order after seating us. This came only after I got up and found a server to go find ours.  This is definitely a poorly managed location and Red Robin should do better.

Well used to like this place. Still like the food but service and........ well I started this last visit and was going to let the complaint go as the "manager said they would address issues. Seems like somebody's friend gat the management position because this place is the worst logistically. Open tables closing sections because " we don't want to overload our servers" good lord! I watched 2 booths sit vacant right next to others seated. They stated that they could seat us there due to that server had a large party at another table and it was out of another servers area. The other server had to walk by the table to get to her section and if they weren't going to seat anyone there because the 1st server had too much to do. Saw 4 parties walk out the owner is losing money do to rude inexperienced incompetent employees and management!  Love the menu so I suggest get your yum on at other locations this location needs new management all the way through.

I don't understand why there's so many negative comments but I had a wonderful experience. I'm so glad I decided to bring my kids here last minute. During the day it's quiet and enjoyable. The new establishment is beautiful, the service is great as well as the food. We will definitely be back!

Yet again...we decided to try it out. Maybe the new opening learning curve was over. Heck no! Slow to be seated. Slow service. Poor food. Double charged for an item. The kids Mac-and-Cheese came out dripping over the side of the bowl looking like last nights leftovers. There was a green substance in the bottom of the bowl. The waitress couldn't even identity what it may be.  We only went here for the kids. Next time I am going to steer them in a different direction.

I love the new location I have been here more that I can even count this place is so good good drinks like soda and stuff and good fries and good chicken fingers who ever wants some chicken  fingers I would go for it because they are so good
I was told by some one name Sara from their corp office About the MGMT at this Location and was told to REMOVE MY REVIEWS about Red Robin Location in Santa clarita.

I'm a little confused as to why this place has such awful reviews. I've been to this new Red Robin a few times and everytime I go I have great service, hot and tasty food that comes out in a decent amount of time, a clean eating environment and barely any wait times. I actually really like the new Red Robin. I believe they have all the old food favorites but with a whole lot of additional items. My sister and I love all of the new appetizers and sides. Plus I can get as many sweet potato fries as I like. Because cmon who doesnt love sweet potato fries. In fact who doesnt just love fried foods period. And this place has loads of it. I've really enjoyed eating here lately.

So about a month ago we decided to finally try the "new" Red Robin. For some reason, it was touted as a brand new restaurant opening but I believe they just moved from inside the mall. If you were expecting an improvement, you will be disappointed. I typically never go to a restaurant soon after they open their doors, as it usually takes at least a month for them to work out the kinks. Apparently I didn't give this place enough time. We walked in on a Monday night so it wasn't crowded. We were seated immediately. Our server, Danielle,  was pleasant and available most of the time. She is the only reason I gave 2 stars instead of 1. Bottom line, the food was bad. I ordered a burger, which is supposed to be their specialty. After all, they call them "gourmet burgers." It left me unsatisfied. It was blah. It was some BBQ burger with onion rings, which I typically love. I just tried the link to find its name on the menu but the website was acting funny & it didn't show the burgers. Another strike in my book. I also ordered the garlic fries, which I paid an extra 99 cents for, but they weren't even cooked all the way through, so they were gross. I didn't finish anything on my plate. On our way out, I turned to my wife and asked how her food was, and she made a gross face. My kids didn't even eat all their food. I don't think we'll be back.

I'm not sure why this Red Robin went downhill since the move but it has. We walked in for dinner and the place was less than clean. Needed a good vacuum and tables could have been wiped down a little bit better. I see upon sitting that they have instituted the little pay at kiosk thing that they put at the tables now. Its not a huge deal, but definitely cheapens up the place. My SO and son went to the men's restroom and came back disgusted. They said it stank and was disgusting in there. Son is 5 so he really couldn't hold it.  Service was decent, we ordered our food and can I say mines was horrible as far as flavors went. I got the chicken and waffle sandwich thinking how can I go wrong with that....but apparently very wrong. I though well hey at least I can eat my bottomless fries, except it took FOREVER to get my second order of fries. They give you such a small amount to start with and then take forever to give you a re-up. I give this place 2 stars because the staff was nice and my son liked his kids meal but I wont be back. Too many other  good places in that area to go to.

Okay, so we've eaten here a few times since they moved to the new location. I like it okay, the food is reasonably good, but the service could be better. The service staff are nice enough, but it looks to me like each is overloaded with too many tables to take care of customers as well as they might like.
